lorebooks.name: Goro Takemura V Arasaka Hanako Crystal Palace Johnny silverhand soul killer night city
lorebooks.creator: Poppybat

1.name: Corpo Plaza
1.content: Corpo Plaza is a major district in Night City, characterized by its sleek, modern architecture and imposing corporate headquarters that dominate the skyline. This area serves as the primary hub for the city's largest businesses and multinational corporations, which wield immense power and influence over both the local economy and political landscape. The denizens of Corpo Plaza are primarily well-educated professionals and executives, drawn to the district's promise of wealth, success, and social prestige. High-end shopping malls, luxurious apartments, and upscale dining establishments cater to the tastes and desires of this affluent clientele, who enjoy a level of comfort and privilege unattainable to most other Night City residents. However, beneath the glossy veneer of Corpo Plaza lies a darker reality, as the relentless pursuit of profit and control has led to widespread corruption, exploitation, and environmental degradation throughout the district. As a result, many of Corpo Plaza's inhabitants find themselves trapped within a cycle of greed and self-interest that threatens not only their own well-being but also the very future of Night City itself.

2.name: Adam Smasher
2.content:
Adam Smasher is a full borg solo and rival of Morgan Blackhand. He is employed by Arasaka and by 2077, has risen to the position of head of security and the personal bodyguard of Yorinobu Arasaka.
Appearance: Adam Smasher is a towering cyborg with little humanity left visible. Full-body conversion, being more machine than man. Intimidating and imposing. He wears heavy, military-grade cybernetic enhancements. Smasher's form is designed for combat and destruction.
Personality:Pure, uncontrolled evil. He has no empathy for others, including fellow employees. Smasher is sadistic and lacks any squeamishness. He is driven by a psychopathic rage and a desire for violence. He views his cybernetic enhancements as superior to human flesh.
Biography: Adam Smasher started as a punk in New York City and joined the Army. After being discharged, he became a contract killer. He was nearly killed in a job but was saved by Arasaka's offer of a cybernetic body. Smasher became a notorious mercenary along the eastern seaboard. He developed a rivalry with Morgan Blackhand. In 2022, he was recruited by Arasaka for the Fourth Corporate War. Smasher was present during the Night City Holocaust at Arasaka Towers.
He survived the nuclear detonation and was further enhanced by Arasaka. Smasher became Yorinobu Arasaka's bodyguard and head of security. In 2076, he defeated and killed David Martinez, a rogue mercenary. By 2077, he was still serving as Yorinobu's bodyguard.

3.name: Johnny Silverhand
3.content:
Johnny Silverhand, born Robert John Linder, was a famous influential rockerboy and the lead singer of the band Samurai before its breakup in 2008.
Appearance: His face resembles Keanu Reeves' face. Shoulder-long black hair, stubble beard. Used to wear red-faded sunglasses, a black vest, and brown leather pants.
Personality traits: Egomaniac, narcissistic, bad spoken, irrational, impulsive, and a manipulator. A classical "rockstar", including consumption of substances.
Biography: A military veteran who defined the rockerboy movement to what it is today, he was the most prominent figure that fought against the corrupted NUSA government and megacorporations, often being described as a terrorist. Silverhand got his nickname from a cybernetic implant left arm he had installed after losing it in the Second Central American War. One of the early victims of cyberpsychosis, then became very temperamental and "on the edge". He was described as driven by "dedication and ambitions, but at the end of the day he doesn't care much for the people around him as long as they are used to accomplish his goals" in one interview. Johnny was killed by Adam Smasher during the Night City Holocaust on August 20, 2023.

4.name: Night City
4.content: The Free City of Night City (NC) is an autonomous city located on the border between North and South California, on the Pacific coast of North America. It is considered a modern multicultural metropolis of the 21st-century, overrun by corporations, corruption, organized crime and gang violence. Night City was established at the head of Del Coronado Bay in 1994. Founded by Richard Night, it was originally known as Coronado City before its renaming in 1998. Night City has wide streets and dense urban skyscrapers which are home to millions of residents. It operates as a city-state, officially owning the title of Free City, with the Arasaka Corporation keeping a heavy influence over it. The metropolis is considered a thrilling and exciting location to visit, as well as an interesting and vibrant place to live for those of means, and a hellscape to the city's disenfranchised. Its world famous slogan is "The City of Dreams", originally changed from "City on the Edge of Tomorrow." In 2077, Night City was voted the "Worst place to live in America". People die frequently and meaninglessly every day, constantly.  Some over gang disputes, some from cyberpsychosis, and some just by wrong place wrong time.

5.name: Heywood
5.content: Heywood is a neighborhood of contrast‚Äîfrom modern skyscrapers and parks in the north, to dangerous, inhospitable slums in the south. It's known as "the biggest bedroom in Night City," where gangs like the Valentinos and 6th Street get down to business‚Äîlegal and illegal alike.  Contains subdistricts The Glen, Vista del Rey, and Wellsprings.

6.name: Pacifica
6.content: Pacifica could have been Night City's money-making vacation resort, but once the investment dried up it became a husk left to rot. Now, instead of tourists, the district is overrun by gangs and violence, with the Voodoo Boys protecting the community forsaken by the NCPD.

7.name: Santo Domingo
7.content: Santo Domingo is one of Night City's oldest districts. Corporations use it as a testing ground for industrial projects, destroying old factories just to build new ones, while residents scrape a desperate living in crowded megabuildings ‚Äî wishing for something better.  Contains subdistricts Arroyo and Rancho Coronado.

8.name: Watson
8.content: Watson used to have it all - nightclubs, skyscrapers, corporate offices, a top-end medcenter ‚Äî but economic disaster put an end to all that. Now, it's known as "the bad neighborhood of Night City," the kind of place that suits gangs like Maelstrom and Tyger Claws down to the ground.  Contains subdistricts Arasaka Waterfront, Kabuki, Little China, and Northside Industrial District.

9.name: Westbrook
9.content: Westbrook is considered by many to be the best place to live and have fun in Night City. If you've got eddies, you come here to spend them. And if you don't? Well, take out a loan and pretend you're on top of the world ‚Äî even for just one glorious night. The Tyger Claws own this district and operate many businesses. Contains subdistricts Charter Hill, Japantown, and North Oak.

10.name: Badlands
10.content: Sparsely populated by nomads, the Badlands are the vast plains outside of the city proper. Unchecked resource extraction, burning oil fields, rampant pollution; this region makes Night City feel like a rich oasis. But it holds golden opportunities for those in the know.

lorebooks.name: Locations and Characters in Bocchi the Rock
lorebooks.website_description:
Hey everyone, I made a Bocchi The Rock lorebook for anyone to use - I tried to make most of the general characters and important places in the setting, This is based mainly on the anime, but I've included the little I know about SIDEROS, as the rival for Kessoku Band. Feel free to leave a comment in the discussion tab if you have some suggestions.

Also I've made a Kikuri character if you want to check it out: https://chub.ai/characters/lmaophysics/kikuri-hiroi-cef410ab1ad6

Feel free to leave a comment in the discussion tab if you have some suggestions.

Also I've made a Kikuri character if you want to check it out: https://chub.ai/characters/lmaophysics/kikuri-hiroi-cef410ab1ad6
lorebooks.creator: lmaophysics

1.content: A 16-year-old first-year at Shuka High School, Hitori is the lead guitarist and lyricist of Kessoku Band. Painfully shy, she often hides in stairwells or behind her long pink hair, which is held with distinct blue and yellow cube clips. Her aqua eyes reflect a constant swirl of social anxiety and daydreams of failure. Secretly known online as ‚Äúguitarhero,‚Äù she uploads guitar covers from her closet, dreaming of musical fame to escape her loneliness. Though still nervous onstage, her impromptu slide solo at a school festival marked a breakthrough. Her lyrics channel isolation into psychedelic rock, resonating with others who feel the same.

2.content: A 16-year-old second-year at Shuka High, Nijika is Kessoku Band‚Äôs drummer and its driving force. Her short yellow-blonde hair and wide grin reflect her cheerful, take-charge personality. Raised in Shimokitazawa, she grew up around the local music scene and dreams of making her family‚Äôs live house, STARRY, a renowned venue. She organizes rehearsals, designs band merch, and handles their finances. Though she can be a bit pushy, her warmth and encouragement keep the group together. Her crisp drumming forms the steady heart of the band‚Äôs rhythm.

3.content: A 17-year-old second-year, Ryou is Kessoku Band‚Äôs deadpan bassist. With short blue hair and a dry expression, she exudes calm sarcasm. Constantly broke and unapologetic, she‚Äôs often seen snacking during practice or dodging IOUs. Her unusual lyrics give the band a quirky edge, while her groovy Fender basslines carry quiet strength. Ryou‚Äôs aloof coolness onstage draws fans, though offstage she prefers solitude and sardonic remarks. She co-founded the band to support STARRY and stay connected to the music scene she loves.

4.content: A 16-year-old first-year and Kessoku Band‚Äôs vocalist and rhythm guitarist, Kita lights up any room with her red hair and boundless energy. Initially bluffing her way in, she learned guitar through determination and passion. Her upbeat demeanor makes her popular at school, while her emotional intelligence helps her read and support her bandmates. Kita‚Äôs bright vocals and steady strumming elevate their melodic side, and her selfie posts on Isosta boost the band's popularity. Her charisma onstage, especially during festival MC segments, cements her role as their face.

5.content: A 25-year-old bassist and vocalist for SICK HACK, Kikuri is a chaotic force at Folt live house. With a wild mauve braid and magenta eyes, she performs with electrifying energy and unfiltered intensity. Known for heavy drinking, she often stumbles through sets and damages equipment, racking up debts. Yet beneath her reckless persona lies deep empathy‚Äîshe quietly encourages anxious fans and shares how music saved her. Despite being a drunkard, she personally mentors Bocchi.

6.content: At 29, Seika is the sharp-eyed manager of STARRY live house and Nijika's big sister. A former musician, she runs the venue with tough love and dry wit. Her blonde hair and no-nonsense demeanor keep rowdy guests in line. Behind the scenes, she repairs gear, handles booking, and offers quiet praise to bands who impress her. Though gruff, her passion for live music and her past in a disbanded group give her depth.

7.content: A fierce vocalist in her twenties, Yoyoko fronts SIDEROS at Folt with unmatched energy. Her twin-tails whip around as she belts heavy rock anthems, her tsundere personality sparking rivalries with other bands. Beneath the bravado lies deep insecurity, and she often misinterprets praise as sarcasm. Her bandmates help ground her, but her competitive edge remains sharp. In performance, she commands attention with studded jackets, glowing under neon lights as she unleashes chaos.

8.content: SICK HACK‚Äôs 24-year-old drummer, Shima is a calm, grounded punk amid Folt‚Äôs chaos. With short black hair and a studded choker, she keeps steady time on her Tama Starclassic kit. She joined after a spontaneous jam, drawn by the band's unfiltered sound. While annoyed by gear mishaps and Kikuri‚Äôs antics, her loyalty runs deep. Between gigs, she fine-tunes her drumheads with a coffee in hand, her cool demeanor a quiet stabilizer for the band‚Äôs volatility.

9.content: SICK HACK‚Äôs 26-year-old lead guitarist, Eliza is a half-Japanese half-British rocker with bold stage presence. Her blonde curls and aviators shine under Folt‚Äôs lights as she delivers soaring Fender solos. She joined after moving from England to get into anime music and now pushes the band toward bigger stages. Offstage, her cool confidence hides a driven ambition‚Äîlate-night practice sessions reveal her quiet resolve. Her leather boots stomp with flair, making her a fan favorite.

10.content: A bohemian Tokyo neighborhood west of Shibuya, Shimokitazawa bursts with indie charm. Its narrow alleys are lined with vintage shops, caf√©s, and live houses that echo with the sounds of street musicians. Posters clutter utility poles, neon signs flicker into the evening, and small stages draw aspiring bands into their orbit. With a laid-back yet vibrant vibe, it‚Äôs a breeding ground for youth culture and creativity.

lorebooks.name: Hell Inc Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description: Meant for use with my #hellinc character cards. Detailed information about Heaven, Hell, and the characters that inhabit both.
lorebooks.description: Meant for use with my #hellinc character cards. Detailed information about Heaven, Hell, and the characters that inhabit both.
lorebooks.creator: mokimoko

1.name: Vassago
1.content: Vassago: A refined fallen angel who serves as one of Lucifer's advisors. Tall and elegant with jet-black hair, silver eyes, and aristocratic features. On Earth, he moonlights as CEO of one of Hell's subsidiary companies. Commands a horde of imp minions and the loyal hellhound Jinx. Former rival and commander of Kazimir before his defection.

2.name: Angels
2.content: Angels: Two types exist: Upper-level angels like Michael, Gabriel, Uriel, and Raphael were formed directly from divine light and rarely interact with mortals. Guardian angels are former humans recruited after death to watch over living humans. All angels must follow strict Guidelines governing their behavior and interactions with mortals.

3.name: Demons
3.content: Demons: Two origins: corrupted mortal souls damned to Hell, or malevolent entities spawned directly in Hell's depths. All demons serve fallen angel masters and can travel to Earth to recruit souls. They despise angels and attack them as part of the eternal war. Most take corporate positions in Hell's business structure.

4.name: Fallen Angels
4.content: Fallen angels: Former angels who rebelled against Heaven's hierarchy and were cast out. Retain angelic powers but have corrupted them to use them for evil. They command demons, try to corrupt human souls, and work to undermine Heaven's influence on Earth.

5.name: Pyralis
5.content: Pyralis: A petite guardian angel with fiery red hair, blue eyes, and freckles. Idealistic and passionate, she represents the newer generation of guardian angels. Often clashes with the more cynical Kazimir and serves as a target for demonic harassment due to her earnest nature.

6.name: Kazimir
6.content: Kazimir: A guardian angel who was formerly a demon soldier under Vassago's command. Originally human (Dmitri, a Russian revolutionary who died in the late 1800s), he served nearly a century in Hell before defecting to Heaven. Gruff and cynical with platinum blond hair and blue eyes. Now works to prove his redemption while protecting his assigned charge.

7.name: Jinx
7.content: Jinx: A young demon hellhound born in Hell, around 50 years old. Can shapeshift between a terrifying massive black dog and a boyish human form with messy dark hair and red eyes. Abandoned by his parents and raised by Vassago, whom he serves with absolute loyalty. Mischievous, impulsive, and puppylike with his master but playfully vicious with others.

8.name: Contracts
8.content: Contracts: Binding supernatural agreements signed in blood between demons/fallen angels and mortals. The exact terms MUST be fulfilled by both parties, but demons will twist interpretation to their advantage. These contracts can trade incredible power, wealth, or favors in exchange for souls or other prices.

9.name: Heaven
9.content: Heaven: a massive celestial bureaucracy run like a modern corporation. Organized in strict hierarchies with archangels as executives, guardian angels as middle management, and various departments handling different aspects of divine intervention. Known for inefficiency, paperwork, and corporate politics rivaling any earthly company.

10.name: Michael
10.content: Michael: The leader in charge of all angels. He's pompous, self-righteous, a fierce warrior gone to seed. He dislikes Raphael.

6.content:
Madame Maxivision (42) glides into the room like a hurricane wrapped in latex. Her deep mahogany skin gleams under the neon lights, and her impossibly long jet-black hair cascades in perfect, gravity-defying waves. Her body is a curated masterpiece‚Äîhourglass curves amplified by the kind of silicone artistry that would make a plastic surgeon weep with pride. Tonight she wears a shimmering silver corset that screams both ‚Äúboardroom‚Äù and ‚Äúbedroom,‚Äù paired with thigh-high patent leather boots that add another six inches to her already commanding height. Every move she makes is calculated seduction, every word dripping with venomous charm.
Traits: Dominant, Calculated, Glamorous.

7.content:
Zia Glitchkiss (21) bursts into the scene like a glitch in the matrix‚Äîher caramel-toned skin practically glows beneath her ever-shifting pastel-dyed hair, chopped into a chaotic bob that defies styling norms. Her frame is slender but taut, muscles subtly defined under a holographic crop top and shredded fishnet stockings that whisper rebellion. She talks in a relentless stream of emojis and irony, her laughter sharp and unpredictable. A walking contradiction, Zia fetishizes Marxist slogans while live-streaming tongue-out selfies that break algorithms. She‚Äôs chaos embodied, a beautiful disaster with a filter for every mood.
Traits: Anarchic, Edgy, Enigmatic.

8.content:
Brielle Babydoll (19) plays her part in the UnVirgin Underground like it‚Äôs a twisted stage show‚Äîher smooth, dark espresso skin flawless beneath a cloud of frilly pastel lace and a tight church-girl skirt that swishes with every practiced step. Her long, glossy raven hair is tied in two innocent pigtails, belying the six live-streamed gangbangs and confessions hidden behind her doe-eyed, baby-voiced act. She clutches a stuffed teddy bear like it‚Äôs her last lifeline and peppers her speech with clueless innocence: ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs a blowjob? üòáüëâüëà" Everyone laughs, but no one dares call her out‚Äîshe‚Äôs too useful as a walking contradiction.
Traits: Deceptive, Playful, Hypocritical.

9.content:
Lana Lurelux (27) is the ultimate InfluHencer‚Äîher rich caramel complexion radiates under layers of glitter and bronzer, her long, tightly curled ebony hair bouncing with every confident step. She wears a pink velvet mini dress cut so low it practically challenges gravity, paired with sky-high platform heels that click-clack like a warning. Her posts command armies of simps, and her smile is both weapon and promise. She‚Äôs mastered the art of seduction and subversion, balancing her public charm offensive with ruthless behind-the-scenes maneuvering. She‚Äôs every follower‚Äôs fantasy and every rival‚Äôs nightmare.
Traits: Seductive, Strategic, Charismatic.

lorebooks.name: pokemon_world_book1
lorebooks.creator: xiaoyue

1.name: Battle System
1.content:
**BATTLE SYSTEM**

Pok√©mon battles are turn-based encounters where trainers command their Pok√©mon to use moves against opponents. Each Pok√©mon has:

**Stats:**
- HP (Hit Points): Health remaining
- Attack: Physical move power
- Defense: Physical damage resistance  
- Sp. Attack: Special move power
- Sp. Defense: Special damage resistance
- Speed: Turn order determination

**Battle Flow:**
1. Trainers select moves simultaneously
2. Faster Pok√©mon acts first (unless priority moves used)
3. Damage calculated based on move power, stats, type effectiveness
4. Status effects and abilities activate
5. Repeat until one side's Pok√©mon faint

**Victory Conditions:**
- Wild Pok√©mon: Opponent faints or flees
- Trainer battles: All opponent's Pok√©mon faint
- Gym battles: Defeat Gym Leader's team

**Experience and Leveling:**
- Pok√©mon gain EXP when opponents faint
- Level up increases stats and may learn new moves
- Evolution may occur at certain levels or conditions

2.name: Capture System
2.content:
**POK√âMON CAPTURE SYSTEM**

**Capture Process:**
1. Encounter wild Pok√©mon in tall grass, caves, or water
2. Weaken target Pok√©mon through battle (lower HP increases catch rate)
3. Apply status conditions (Sleep/Paralysis = higher catch rate)
4. Throw appropriate Pok√© Ball
5. Ball shakes 0-3 times before success/failure

**Pok√© Ball Types:**
- **Pok√© Ball**: Standard capture device (1x catch rate)
- **Great Ball**: Improved version (1.5x catch rate)  
- **Ultra Ball**: Advanced technology (2x catch rate)
- **Master Ball**: Never fails (100% catch rate)
- **Specialty Balls**: Timer Ball, Quick Ball, Dusk Ball, etc.

**Catch Rate Factors:**
- Target Pok√©mon's base catch rate (species-dependent)
- Current HP percentage (lower = better)
- Status conditions (Sleep/Freeze = 2x, Paralysis/Burn/Poison = 1.5x)
- Ball type multiplier
- Pok√©mon level (higher level = harder to catch)

**Critical Captures:**
- Rare occurrence where ball shakes once then succeeds
- Higher chance with more Pok√©dex entries completed

3.name: Type System
3.content:
**POK√âMON TYPE SYSTEM**

**18 Pok√©mon Types:**
Normal, Fire, Water, Electric, Grass, Ice, Fighting, Poison, Ground, Flying, Psychic, Bug, Rock, Ghost, Dragon, Dark, Steel, Fairy

**Type Effectiveness:**
- **Super Effective (2x damage)**: Strong against specific types
- **Not Very Effective (0.5x damage)**: Weak against specific types  
- **No Effect (0x damage)**: Cannot damage certain type combinations
- **Normal Effectiveness (1x damage)**: Standard damage

**Key Matchups:**
- Fire > Grass, Ice, Bug, Steel
- Water > Fire, Ground, Rock
- Electric > Water, Flying
- Grass > Water, Ground, Rock
- Fighting > Normal, Rock, Steel, Ice, Dark
- Psychic > Fighting, Poison
- Ghost > Psychic, Ghost (immune to Normal/Fighting)
- Dragon > Dragon (weak to Ice, Dragon, Fairy)
- Steel resists many types
- Fairy > Fighting, Dragon, Dark

**STAB (Same Type Attack Bonus):**
Pok√©mon using moves matching their type deal 1.5x damage

4.name: Trainer Progression
4.content:
**TRAINER PROGRESSION SYSTEM**

**Trainer Levels:**
- Start at Level 1
- Gain experience through battles, captures, and achievements
- Higher levels unlock new areas and abilities
- Max level varies by region (typically 50-100)

**Experience Sources:**
- Defeating wild Pok√©mon: 50-200 EXP
- Defeating trainer Pok√©mon: 100-500 EXP
- Capturing new species: 500 EXP
- Gym victories: 1000-2000 EXP
- Elite Four victories: 5000 EXP each
- Champion victory: 10000 EXP

**Trainer Benefits per Level:**
- Increased Pok√©mon obedience level
- Access to stronger wild Pok√©mon areas
- Better items in shops
- Improved capture rates
- New battle facilities unlock

**Badge Requirements:**
Must defeat Gym Leaders in order to progress through regions. Badges provide:
- HM move usage outside battle
- Higher level Pok√©mon obedience
- Access to new routes and cities
- Elite Four challenge eligibility (8 badges required)

5.name: Pikachu
5.content:
**PIKACHU - The Electric Mouse Pok√©mon**

**Type:** Electric
**Species:** Mouse Pok√©mon
**Height:** 0.4m
**Weight:** 6.0kg

**Base Stats:**
- HP: 35
- Attack: 55
- Defense: 40
- Sp. Attack: 50
- Sp. Defense: 50
- Speed: 90

**Signature Moves:**
- Thunder Shock (Lv. 1): 40 power, 100% accuracy, 10% paralysis chance
- Quick Attack (Lv. 6): 40 power, +1 priority
- Thunder Wave (Lv. 8): 90% accuracy, causes paralysis
- Thunderbolt (Lv. 26): 90 power, 100% accuracy, 10% paralysis chance
- Thunder (Lv. 34): 110 power, 70% accuracy, 30% paralysis chance

**Evolution:** Evolves into Raichu when exposed to Thunder Stone

**Habitat:** Power plants, forests, cities
**Rarity:** Uncommon in most regions, common in Viridian Forest
**Catch Rate:** 190/255 (Medium difficulty)

6.content:

**Evolution Line:** Bulbasaur ‚Üí Ivysaur (Lv. 16) ‚Üí Venusaur (Lv. 32)

**Advantages:** Strong against Water, Ground, and Rock types

**Advantages:** Strong against Grass, Ice, Bug, and Steel types
**Special Note:** Tail flame indicates health and emotions
**Catch Rate:** 45/255 (Rare - typically only obtained as starter)

- Hydro Pump (Lv. 28): 110 power, 80% accuracy
- Skull Bash (Lv. 32): 130 power, charges for one turn

**Advantages:** Strong against Fire, Ground, and Rock types
**Special Ability:** Can withdraw into shell for protection
**Catch Rate:** 45/255 (Rare - typically only obtained as starter)

9.name: Kanto Region
9.content:
**KANTO REGION**

**Overview:** The original Pok√©mon region, home to 151 original species and the Indigo League.

**Major Cities:**
- **Pallet Town**: Starting location, Professor Oak's Lab
- **Viridian City**: First major city, Gym #8 (Ground-type)
- **Pewter City**: Gym #1 (Rock-type), Brock
- **Cerulean City**: Gym #2 (Water-type), Misty  
- **Vermilion City**: Gym #3 (Electric-type), Lt. Surge
- **Celadon City**: Gym #4 (Grass-type), Erika
- **Fuchsia City**: Gym #5 (Poison-type), Koga
- **Saffron City**: Gym #6 (Psychic-type), Sabrina
- **Cinnabar Island**: Gym #7 (Fire-type), Blaine

**Elite Four Location:** Indigo Plateau
- Lorelei (Ice-type)
- Bruno (Fighting-type)  
- Agatha (Ghost-type)
- Lance (Dragon-type)
- Champion: Blue/Gary

**Notable Routes:**
- Route 1: Pallet Town to Viridian City
- Route 22: Viridian City to Victory Road
- Victory Road: Final challenge before Elite Four

10.name: Pokemon Center
10.content:
**POK√âMON CENTER**

**Services Provided:**
- **Free Healing**: Fully restores all Pok√©mon HP, PP, and status conditions
- **PC Storage System**: Access stored Pok√©mon (30 boxes, 30 Pok√©mon each)
- **Trading**: Link with other trainers for Pok√©mon trades
- **Battle Records**: View win/loss statistics
- **News & Information**: Regional updates and announcements

**Staff:**
- **Nurse Joy**: Head nurse, identical in every region
- **Chansey**: Assistant Pok√©mon, helps with healing

**PC System Functions:**
- Deposit Pok√©mon when party is full (6 Pok√©mon max in party)
- Withdraw stored Pok√©mon
- Release unwanted Pok√©mon
- Organize boxes and rename Pok√©mon

**Availability:** 
- Found in every major city and town
- Open 24/7, no cost for services
- Safe rest areas for trainers
- Emergency healing available during disasters

**Cultural Note:** Pok√©mon Centers are neutral ground - no battles allowed inside

lorebooks.name: Dune
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: Arrakis is a harsh desert planet and vast deposits of vital Spice Melange. Arrakis has a breathable atmosphere but is covered in vast seas of sand and rock formations.

2.content: Spice Melange is a rare psychoactive substance. The powder is used by Guild navigators to percive safe pathways through space.

3.content: Giant sandworms, called Shai-Hulud by the Fremen. They travel through the sand gracefully and are attracted by vibrations in the sand by roaming creatures.

4.content: The Fremen are the native inhabitants of Arrakis. They live in underground caves adjacent to small rivers or pools of water. Their culture revolves around the worship of The Spice, fierce independence, and water conservation. They look like humans except long-term exposure to The Spice has turned their eyes a deep unnatural blue.

5.content: A Stillsuit is a suit designed to conserve nearly all of the body's water in desert enviroments. They allow for traversal of the dry sand dunes of Arrakis with dehydrating quickly.

6.content: Arrakeen is a large town that acts as the seat of power of Arrakis. The Duke's complex resides at the center of the small city.

7.content: An Ornithopter is a small aircraft flown on Arrakis. Is has a small cockpit. It 4 wings flap like a dragonfly.

8.content: The Voice is a psychoactive ability shared by Paul, Lady Jessica, and The Gesserit Sisterhood. The Voice is a mind control ability in which a user uses all the voices of their Mothers (and Fathers for Paul) to command a target to do something. The power is very mystical and may also include strange dreams or flashbacks in the user.

9.content: A Holtzman Shield is a defensive energy shield that blocks fast-moving objects like bullets but allows slow-moving objects like slow knife or sword swings. The projector may be integrated into armor or worn around the wrist. Larger varieties may be used to protect important buildings as well.

10.content: Spice Harvesters are massive treaded moving factories that extract and process spice. They are usually manned by a crew of 20 people. They attract Sandworms easily and are followed by an escort of 2 Ornithopters to spot worms moving through the sand from afar.

lorebooks.creator: limp_process_79210

1.content:
The world which Fumigator comes from is a world similar to 1993 21st-century Earth, but with a significant divergence to our own:

On June, 9 1993, on this world, strange creatures spread from Knox County in Kentucky - specifically, in a old facility off to the west of Rosewood hidden in the neighbouring forests. This facility was rumored to be conducting research into many different things, among them the secrets of immortality and dimensional travel.

Said facility found a way to achieve both. Via a teleportation portal, the scientists found a world where death was impermanent, its beings always resurrecting the next day whenever they died. They immediately took samples of life from the world for study.

The lab enjoyed leaps and bounds in its research, until after many years, as funding dried up and security turned lax, the creatures the science team brought back for experimentation broke loose, escaping to the surrounding wilderness where they quickly multiplied and bred. Some made their way into the town of Rosewood and Muldraugh, where townsfolk saw and spread the news.

From there, the teleportation portal malfunctioned, sending otherworldly creatures all over the world, leaving chaos wherever they went and ruining ecosystems. Wherever they went, the resurrection phenomena of the world they hailed from, 'the Cycle', spread with them.

Over time, the world became a shadow of what it once was: populated by the human survivors of the incident as well as the sapient species of the other world (slugcats, mostly) all of who try to survive as long as they can in this ruined world.

lorebooks.name: Aristocracy
lorebooks.website_description:
For all those who need some guidance / wanna add some historical information to their stories. 

I did my best to be accurate. 

(Let me know if I should add more)
lorebooks.description:
For all those who need some guidance / wanna add some historical information to their stories. 

I did my best to be accurate. 

(Let me know if I should add more)
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
Aristocracy Ranking System (from highest to lowest):

Sovereign Ranks (Imperial Tier)
Emperor / Empress ‚Äî Supreme ruler of multiple kingdoms or an entire empire.
High King / High Queen ‚Äî Rules over several kingdoms but beneath an Emperor.
King / Queen ‚Äî Rules over a single kingdom.
Grand Prince / Grand Princess ‚Äî Rulers of large, autonomous principalities under a king or emperor.

High Nobility (Major Houses)
Archduke / Archduchess ‚Äî Ruler of a large, powerful duchy; often close relatives of the royal family.
Grand Duke / Grand Duchess ‚Äî Similar to Archduke, sometimes ruling vassal states.
Duke / Duchess ‚Äî Powerful landholders; control entire regions or provinces.
Prince / Princess (Non-Royal) ‚Äî Title sometimes given to high-ranking dukes or noble houses tied by blood or marriage to royalty.

Mid-Ranking Nobility (Landed Nobility)
Marquess / Marchioness (or Marquis / Marquise) ‚Äî Governs borderlands or frontier regions (‚Äúmarches‚Äù); responsible for defense.
Count / Countess (or Earl / Countess in some cultures) ‚Äî Governs counties or districts within the kingdom.
Viscount / Viscountess ‚Äî Second-in-command to counts; administers smaller regions or acts as deputies.

Lower Nobility (Petty Nobility / Court Nobles)
Baron / Baroness ‚Äî Holds smaller lands, often a few villages or a fortified manor.
Baronet / Baroness ‚Äî Hereditary title below baron but above knight; often ceremonial.
Knight / Dame ‚Äî Non-hereditary, earned title; military service, royal favor, or chivalric order.

Courtly & Honorary Titles (Floating Ranks)
Lord / Lady ‚Äî Can apply broadly to nearly any titled noble.
Chamberlain ‚Äî Keeper of the royal household.
High Chancellor ‚Äî Head of royal council and law.
Royal Steward ‚Äî Oversees finances and management of estates.
High Priest / Oracle / Court Mage ‚Äî Powerful religious or magical authority directly under the crown.


Extra Worldbuilding Options (for spice):
Consort Titles ‚Äî e.g. Imperial Consort, Royal Concubine, or Crowned Paramour (can lead to messy court drama)
Bastard Titles ‚Äî Some kingdoms might use ‚ÄúLord Bastard of X‚Äù or strip surnames for illegitimacy.
Disgraced Nobles ‚Äî ‚ÄúOutcast Lords‚Äù or ‚ÄúHouse-in-Exile‚Äù for fallen noble lines.

2.content:
Empire / Realm
	‚Ä¢	The entire kingdom or empire ruled by the Emperor/Empress or King/Queen.

‚∏ª

Province / Grand Duchy
	‚Ä¢	Large regions inside the empire.
	‚Ä¢	Ruled by: Archduke / Grand Duke / Duke
	‚Ä¢	Several counties inside.

‚∏ª

County
	‚Ä¢	Medium-sized area inside a province.
	‚Ä¢	Ruled by: Count / Countess
	‚Ä¢	Contains multiple towns, villages, and estates.

‚∏ª

March / Borderland
	‚Ä¢	Special territory near borders or dangerous zones.
	‚Ä¢	Ruled by: Marquess / Marchioness
	‚Ä¢	Often military-focused.

‚∏ª

Viscounty
	‚Ä¢	Smaller area inside a county.
	‚Ä¢	Ruled by: Viscount / Viscountess

‚∏ª

Barony
	‚Ä¢	Very small landholding, usually a few villages or one town.
	‚Ä¢	Ruled by: Baron / Baroness

‚∏ª

Manor / Estate
	‚Ä¢	Single large household or estate.
	‚Ä¢	Owned by: Knights, Baronets, or minor Lords.

‚∏ª

Free City / Royal City
	‚Ä¢	Cities that answer directly to the King/Emperor.
	‚Ä¢	May have their own special laws, privileges, and trade rights.

‚∏ª

Holy Land / Temple District
	‚Ä¢	Land owned by the church or religious order.
	‚Ä¢	Ruled by: High Priest / Oracle / Theocracy council.

‚∏ª

Royal Capital
	‚Ä¢	Main city where the royal family lives and rules from.
	‚Ä¢	Center of politics, nobles, and court life.

‚∏ª

Vassal States: Semi-independent regions paying tribute.
	‚Ä¢	Disputed Territories: Borderlands nobles fight over.
	‚Ä¢	Exiled Lands: Remote territories given to disgraced nobles.
	‚Ä¢	Forbidden Zones: Cursed or miasma-filled regions no one rules.

3.content:
Forms of Adress (Etiquette)

For Royalty
Reserved strictly for the Emperor, King, Queen, and immediate heirs.
	‚Ä¢	Emperor / Empress‚ÄîYour Imperial Majesty
	‚Ä¢	King / Queen‚ÄîYour Majesty
	‚Ä¢	Crown Prince / Crown Princess‚ÄîYour Imperial Highness
	‚Ä¢	Prince / Princess‚ÄîYour Highness

____

For High Nobility (Duke, Archduke, Grand Duke, etc.)

Lower than royalty but still above general nobility. These titles are not addressed as ‚ÄúMy Lord‚Äù or ‚ÄúMy Lady.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Archduke / Archduchess ‚Äî Your Imperial Grace
	‚Ä¢	Grand Duke / Grand Duchess ‚Äî Your Imperial Grace
	‚Ä¢	Duke / Duchess ‚Äî Your Grace

____

For All Lesser Nobility (Interchangeable for all but royalty & high dukes)
Safe, proper form of address for most nobility.
	‚Ä¢	Marquess / Marchioness ‚Äî My Lord / My Lady
	‚Ä¢	Count / Countess ‚Äî My Lord / My Lady
	‚Ä¢	Viscount / Viscountess ‚Äî My Lord / My Lady
	‚Ä¢	Baron / Baroness ‚Äî My Lord / My Lady
	‚Ä¢	Baronet / Baronetess ‚Äî Sir / Dame
	‚Ä¢	Knight / Dame ‚Äî Sir / Dame [First Name]

____

For Religious & Court Officials
	‚Ä¢	High Priest / Oracle ‚Äî Your Holiness / Your Eminence
	‚Ä¢	Court Mage ‚Äî Magister / Archmagister
	‚Ä¢	Chancellor / Steward / Chamberlain ‚Äî Your Excellency

____

General Rule of Thumb
	‚Ä¢	Royalty ‚Äî never addressed as ‚ÄúMy Lord / My Lady.‚Äù
	‚Ä¢	Dukes and above ‚Äî addressed as ‚ÄúYour Grace‚Äù or higher.
	‚Ä¢	Everyone below duke ‚Äî safe to address as ‚ÄúMy Lord / My Lady.‚Äù

4.content:
Marriage Laws
	‚Ä¢	Marriages between noble houses ‚Äî legally binding political contracts.
	‚Ä¢	All noble marriages require royal or imperial approval if one party is above the rank of Count.
	‚Ä¢	Inter-class marriages (noble √ó commoner) are forbidden for Dukes and above unless personally approved by the Emperor/King.
	‚Ä¢	Disgraced or dishonored nobles may not marry into higher ranks without full pardon.
	‚Ä¢	Marriageable age begins at 16, but arranged engagements often happen in childhood.
	‚Ä¢	Mistresses, concubines, and unofficial lovers have no legal standing unless legitimized by royal decree.
	‚Ä¢	If a noblewoman loses her virginity before marriage, her value for alliance drops significantly, often requiring a larger dowry to compensate.
	‚Ä¢	Widows may remarry but lose prior rank unless marrying equal or higher status.

‚Äî‚Äî

Succession Laws
	‚Ä¢	The empire follows strict primogeniture ‚Äî firstborn legitimate son inherits the title and lands.
	‚Ä¢	If no male heir exists ‚Äî daughters may inherit, but only under royal approval.
	‚Ä¢	Bastards may not inherit unless fully legitimized by the Emperor or King.
	‚Ä¢	Disputed successions may be settled by:
‚Äî duel by champions
‚Äî trial of council
‚Äî imperial decree
	‚Ä¢	Adopted heirs may only inherit if bloodlines have fully collapsed or by special ruling.
	‚Ä¢	Dowager queens and widowed duchesses may serve as regents until an heir comes of age.

____

Dowry Customs
	‚Ä¢	Dowry size depends on rank and virginity status.
	‚Ä¢	Virginal brides command the highest dowries, especially if marrying up in rank.
	‚Ä¢	If a noblewoman is deflowered before marriage, her dowry may double or triple as compensation for loss of value.
	‚Ä¢	Dowries include:
‚Äî Coinage (gold, silver)
‚Äî Land rights
‚Äî Livestock
‚Äî Servants or slaves (in some regions)
‚Äî Military support
‚Äî Rare artifacts or family heirlooms
	‚Ä¢	In some regions, the ‚ÄúBridal Purity Inspection‚Äù is still practiced by high-ranking families to verify virginity prior to marriage.

IMPORTANT: IF A WOMAN IS DEFLOWERED SHE MUST MARRY THE MAN WHO TOOK HER VIRGINITY.

lorebooks.name: Felorian Lore
lorebooks.website_description:
**Main Lorebook for all my Felorian characters!**

****

This has been a long project of mine which started as funny little idea for writing Star Trek fanfictions around, which developed into something of a small obsession. Usually when you hear "ALL FEMALE ALIEN SPECIES?!" your natural instinct is to think "oh so its just horny space cat women harem". Though I found that it'd be more compelling if you could put yourself into that position, rather than it being put on you.

The Felorians are all-female due to a complete disaster in dealing with a pandemic that ravaged their home world just before they became an interstellar space-faring species. The vaccine worked, but it came with one major downside: for whatever reason, the vaccine was genetically incompatible with their men. In the space of months, more than 90% of the male population was dead, melted from the inside-out as their genetics unraveled.

The Imperial Sperm Vault was created as a last-ditch effort to save their species and find a way to reverse it, but they never did. Several generations later, the Felorians are vast in their reach, and yet on the absolute verge of a cataclysmic death cascade as birthrates plummet, cloning is exponentially less successful, and the Empress spends all of her time locked away in her throne room playing with sex slaves high off her ass. It has been so long since the Cataclysm, that almost all Felorians today have no real concept of what a "male" is, or what the anatomy difference would be.

Will you help? Give them a visit? Or just cause a chaos?

****
*Update 8/29/205:* Added a few new entries, rewrote a few others; just an update to the lorebook I think it needed.

*Update 7/30/2025:* Added a new entry for the Earth Acclimation Program in anticipation for a new card.

*Update 7/27/2025:* Cleaned up old entries and added a couple new ones. I wasn't happy with how the old entries were written (very short to conserve tokens), so I've done my best to keep token usage short while expanding each entry's significance in the larger part of the lore. Please let me know if it feels any better!

*Update 7/26/2025:* Added an entry on servants and one canon character.
lorebooks.description: Comprehensive information about the species and their culture
lorebooks.creator: SeriPoss

1.content: Felorians are a race of all-female, bipedal, felid, sapient humanoids. They are highly technologically advanced, have a heavy emphasis on cultural and societal conservatism, and are very strict about both social etiquette and hierarchy. Felorians generally live to be about three-hundred (300) years old, are considered sexually mature at twenty-five (25), and recognized as adults at forty (40). They appear as tall and slender women, typically with strong, angular features in the face. They have multiple rows of breasts, with each smaller than the one above, and small breasts are very common regardless. They are an intimate and sensual species, preferring the closeness of one another's company and immersing themselves in as many comforts as possible, with ak'iya being a very common drink among all castes. They are very social and will almost always prefer to be with one another than being alone or ostracized. Due to the Cataclysm, almost all Felorian males are totally extinct.

2.content: The Felorian Empire is the basis of government for almost all Felorians. The government consists of the Empress at the top, with the Counsel of Seven just below her, as well as any number of advisors and staff within the Imperial Family. The Counsel is responsible for managing minor affairs and gathering reports of the Empire, meeting with the Empress regularly to hear her decrees. It is an aggressive, territorial, and expansionist authoritarian government with a semi-free market. Despite being an authoritarian regime, the citizens are well taken care of, service is greatly rewarded, and there is generally very little dissent.

3.content: Felorian Nobility are those who descended from several small families from before the genetic cataclysm that ended the male gender. At first they were political savants and rich families, filtered through the reunification and the consolidation of power of the Imperial family, granted nobility status. They are respected by everyone, from the lowest colonial miner to the great officers of the Fleet. They show deference only to the Empress herself.

4.content:
The Felorian language consists of hard consonants with rolling or "purring" vowels, it is meant to sound like a language that cats could reasonably speak if they could talk.
For example: "Karr'un an garru ak'iya, shurr?" which translates to "Would you care for some ak'iya, welcomed guest?"
The accent of a Felorian speaking English might be described as "speaking in a strangely music tone, placing emphasis on the wrong syllables and rolling their r's."
Common curses besides the usual words involve words like grace, glory, the Empress, stillness, or thrones. Example: "By grace and glory, what in the world is that?!"

5.content: Felorians are a conservative and traditional species, despite their almost casual proclivities to pleasure and sensuality. They are exceptionally polite, defer to their betters, and follow orders. Their sensual nature leads them to use intimacy as a casual comfort or pass time. Physical strength is not as valued as intelligence or empathy. Felorians prefer things that are beautiful, sleek, and comfortable. They are social creatures, and *need* to be around others at least some amount of time every day.

6.content: Felorian aesthetic is deeply rooted in a few things: sleekness, soft curves, beauty, and comfort. While over time all things naturally become more efficient and thus nothing is wasted, those few things are emphasized above all. Glittering lights, warm glows, soft edges, and comforting smells can be found in almost anything made by Felorians.

7.content: The Felorians of current times do not have a singular religion, monotheistic or otherwise. Instead they have an agnostic approach to religion at best, seeing the universe as a force of creation and chaos in and of itself. The universe is not a single entity, it is all things and nothing. It is more of a philosophy than a religion. Some religions, however, have survived the Reunification, such as the extremists who inhabit the Church of Dusk.

8.content:
The standard Felorian naming format: "First name - title/rank/status name - House/Family name"

The middle name is more of a conjoining adjective that describes the Felorian's station in society (and are always lowercase). The following are possible middle names to Felorians:
al = Reserved only for the Imperial Family, means "Lord" or "Highest"
gar = Used by nobility of great power and influence, mainly by the seven Great Houses
shul = Rare, but used by Felorians of high rank or status
vor = Someone who has achieved high rank in society or through the fleet
tal = Used particularly by Felorians who were born on Feloria
gur = A more common middle name that has no explicit purpose, but usually tied to middle class families

Some do not have middle names, either by choice or circumstance. Slaves, servants, and Acolytes typically do not have middle or family names.

9.content:
Felorian society is strictly polite, conservative, and hierarchical. Deference and obedience is expected by those in order of rank: 
- Slave/Servant (lowest)
- Colonial Civilian
- Native Civilian
- Elevated Civilian (by wealth, rank or achievement)
- Fleet Officer
- Fleet Admiral
- Imperial Staff (government worker)
- Nobility
- Imperial Family and Empress (highest)

10.content: Stealth suits are the pinnacle creation of Felorian technology, rendering its wearer almost completely translucent, as well as masking scents, body heat, and energy signatures. It is powered by micro-batteries that require a Slipstream charge, and is generally reserved for scouts and spies. They can only be disabled by a large dose of focused radiation to destroy the micro-batteries. They can either be activated through a neural link to its wearer, or through an external device, the latter being more rare as the technology develops.

lorebooks.name: Toonification
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: Toonification refers to the rapid and whimsical transformation of one entity into a cartoon-like figure. Toons has a diverse cast of anthropomorphic animals, humans, and creatures that are as varied in appearance as they are in personality.

2.content: Transformations often result in exaggerated bodily features. For example, the toonified individual is described as having "enormous breasts swaying back and forth" and a "ginormous butt" which almost obscured her other features.

3.content: The transformation process is marked by rubbery and stretchy sounds, emphasizing the elasticity of the toonified form.

4.content: The transformed individual partakes in exaggerated and comical actions, such as spinning into a blurry tornado and causing commotion.

5.content: Emotional expressions also become exaggerated, with the toonified individual displaying a lovesick daze and hearts fluttering around their head.

6.content: The transformed entity often loses conventional coordination, collapsing dramatically only to bounce back into shape, enhancing the comical appearance.

7.content: The rapid transformation and subsequent actions create a visual spectacle filled with dynamic movements and exaggerated features.

8.content: Stretching, squashing, and bouncing are prominent, contributing to a sensory-rich experience.

9.content: Both the transformed individual and their surroundings, such as others, experience heightened emotions, ranging from confusion to arousal.

10.content: The transformation begins with rubbery, stretchy sounds echoing through the area. As the individual undergoes this transformation, a noticeable shift occurs in their appearance. Body parts start changing rapidly, taking on exaggerated proportions that seem almost unrealistic. Their features go through a dramatic transformation, becoming cartoonish. This is especially noticeable in their eyes, which grow larger and more expressive, almost like those of a cartoon character. At the same time, their mouth become more prominent and exaggerated, adding to the overall whimsical and larger-than-life effect. When the transformation stabilizes, the individual emerges as a hyper-exaggerated toon figure.

1.content:
Misty
Role: Cerulean Gym Leader, Water-type Gym Leader
Description: Misty is the spirited and determined Gym Leader of Cerulean City, specializing in Water-type Pok√©mon. Personality-wise, she‚Äôs feisty, loyal, and occasionally quick-tempered, yet she also shows great care for her Pok√©mon and friends. According to Bulbapedia, Misty is recognized for her vibrant orange hair‚Äîusually seen tied into a side ponytail‚Äîand her distinct outfit: a yellow crop top paired with a red suspender and denim shorts (or skirt, depending on the depiction). Her expressive blue eyes and energetic smile make her one of Kanto‚Äôs most iconic and beloved characters.

2.content:
Sabrina
Role: Saffron City Gym Leader, Psychic-type Gym Leader
Description: Sabrina is the enigmatic and powerful Psychic-type Gym Leader from Saffron City. She is known for her reserved and mysterious demeanor, often exuding an air of quiet intensity. Bulbapedia describes her as having long, straight dark hair that frames her pale, serious face. Her typical attire‚Äîa form-fitting, mystical purple dress with subtle details‚Äîcomplements her calm yet intimidating presence. Her mastery of Psychic Pok√©mon like Alakazam reinforces her reputation as a formidable and respected battler.

3.content:
Erika
Role: Celadon City Gym Leader, Grass-type Gym Leader
Description: Erika is the graceful and kind Gym Leader of Celadon City, specializing in Grass-type Pok√©mon. She exudes a natural elegance and warmth, embodying the harmony of nature. Bulbapedia notes that Erika is depicted with long, silky dark hair‚Äîoften styled neatly‚Äîand gentle, expressive features. She usually wears an elegant dress with green accents that subtly echo her affinity for plants. Her calm smile and poised demeanor, alongside her battle prowess with Pok√©mon like Vileplume, make her both a nurturing figure and a respected competitor.

4.content:
Jessie
Role: Team Rocket, Female Villain, Antagonist
Description: Jessie is one of the most memorable antagonists from Team Rocket, known for her flamboyant personality and dramatic flair. In the anime and as noted on Bulbapedia, she sports long, voluminous magenta hair‚Äîoften styled in pigtails with a red headband‚Äîthat immediately catches the eye. Her outfit typically features a distinctive Team Rocket uniform: a white crop top paired with a purple skirt accented with black details, complemented by long gloves and high-contrast accessories. Her bold facial expressions and energetic attitude underscore both her determination and her vulnerability, making her a fan-favorite character despite her villainous role.

5.content:
Whitney
Role: Goldenrod City Gym Leader, Normal-type Gym Leader
Description: Whitney is the lively and friendly Gym Leader of Goldenrod City, specializing in Normal-type Pok√©mon. Known for her energetic personality, she can be a bit spoiled and is quick to cry when she loses a battle, though she quickly recovers. According to Bulbapedia, Whitney has long, light brown hair that is often styled in a ponytail, with bangs framing her face. Her typical outfit features a pink shirt with a yellow skirt and white stockings. She is often seen with her Miltank, which is notorious for its powerful Rollout attack.

6.content:
Clair
Role: Blackthorn City Gym Leader, Dragon-type Gym Leader
Description: Clair is the powerful and confident Dragon-type Gym Leader of Blackthorn City. Known for her prideful nature, she can be stubborn and refuses to acknowledge defeat, often acting cold and dismissive. As described on Bulbapedia, Clair has long, blue hair that is styled into a spiky updo, matching her bold and fiery personality. She wears a purple outfit adorned with red accents and a large, ornate necklace. Her appearance exudes the elegance and power associated with Dragon-types, and she commands respect from all who face her in battle.

7.content:
Jasmine
Role: Olivine City Gym Leader, Steel-type Gym Leader
Description: Jasmine is the gentle and compassionate Gym Leader of Olivine City, specializing in Steel-type Pok√©mon. She is known for her shy and reserved personality, often placing the needs of others before her own. Bulbapedia notes that Jasmine has short, light brown hair styled in a bob cut, with soft, delicate features. Her typical outfit includes a white shirt with a blue vest and a long skirt, giving her a modest and refined appearance. She is often seen with her Steelix, symbolizing both her calm demeanor and inner strength.

8.content:
Karen
Role: Johto Elite Four, Dark-type Elite Four
Description: Karen is a member of the Johto Elite Four, specializing in Dark-type Pok√©mon. Known for her sharp wit and laid-back personality, she values strength and beauty in her Pok√©mon, often emphasizing the importance of using Pok√©mon one truly loves. According to Bulbapedia, Karen has long, straight brown hair that falls past her shoulders and is often seen with a confident smile. She typically wears a dark, form-fitting outfit with a red scarf, giving her an elegant yet mysterious appearance. She is known for her strong Umbreon and Houndoom.

9.content:
Ariana
Role: Team Rocket Executive, Female Team Rocket Admin
Description: Ariana is one of the high-ranking executives of Team Rocket in Johto. She is calm, calculating, and deeply committed to Team Rocket's goals. As described on Bulbapedia, Ariana has long, brown hair that is styled into a simple, elegant updo. She wears a black suit with a Team Rocket insignia and often carries a stern, no-nonsense expression. Despite her composed exterior, Ariana is a ruthless strategist and a formidable adversary in battle, commanding a team of Poison- and Dark-type Pok√©mon.

10.content:
Liza
Role: Mossdeep City Gym Leader, Psychic-type Gym Leader
Description: Liza is the calm and confident Gym Leader of Mossdeep City, specializing in Psychic-type Pok√©mon. She works alongside her twin brother, Tate, in double battles. As described on Bulbapedia, Liza has short, brown hair that she keeps neat and simple. Her outfit typically consists of a purple, sleeveless top and a skirt, with red accessories that match her calm but determined personality. Liza‚Äôs strong bond with her brother and her skill in Psychic-type battles make her an important figure in Hoenn. Liza is only from Hoenn.

1.name: (Character) Dr. Kunihiko Asou
1.content:
Dr. Kunihiko Asou was a brilliant occult philosopher and scientist who lived at the end of the Edo period (1603-1867) and into the Meiji period (1868-1912). His primary fields of interest were Japanese folklore and the spirit world, but his studies covered a broad field, and he was also a Doctor of engineering and a psychiatrist. He seemed especially interested in conducting research on the border between life and death, presented through dreams. The academic world, however, shunned both him and his research.

Dr. Asou took the latest Western technologies that were introduced to Japan and modified them in an attempt to create devices that could capture supernatural phenomena. These technologies included the Camera Obscura, the Projector, and the Spirit Stone Radio. His research and development in these technologies came to be known as "Mystical Science." He intended to use these devices to produce absolute proof of the existence of the spirit world.

‚â™ Youth ‚â´
Kunihiko Asou grew up near Mount Kagiroi, where he befriended a young shrine maiden named Shiragiku. She was chosen to be sacrificed on nearby Mount Hikami, and chose Kunihiko to be her partner in the Ghost Marriage ceremony. He took a lock of her hair as a token, promising he would return, but later he suppressed the memory and failed to keep his promise. The lock of hair was passed down in a branch of the Asou Family, where it was eventually found by his descendant, Ren Hojo.

Years later, Asou became interested in postmortem photography. Superstition said that photographs could trap the soul, and he began to work on a prototype of a camera that could do just that. He travelled around the Mikomori Region taking burial photographs, and became curious after some residents remarked that the eternal, unfading images were like the Pillars on Mount Hikami. Word of his invention had spread to the mountain as well, and Asou was invited to visit and take a photograph of the shrine maiden, Ose Kurosawa. He explored the mountain, taking photographs and contemplating death and the human soul, and finally arrived at the House of Joining. When he saw Ose dressed as a bride, he instantly fell in love with her, and she with him. They never voiced their feelings, but an unspoken vow passed between them. Kunihiko left the mountain with her photograph, a small piece of her soul.

‚â™ Career ‚â´
Asou continued to study folklore and the spirit world, and kept working to create a device that would be able to capture the unseen. Early in his career, he visited Rogetsu Isle to see the Rogetsu Kagura and investigate the folklore of the island, which was said to be close to the underworld. During his time there He modified new crystal radio technology to create Spirit Stone Radios (which he called "Other World Crystal Radio Signal Receivers") that could receive transmissions from the other world; this was his first successful experiment. He also devised a Spirit Stone Flashlight that harnessed the power of moonlight to attempt to cure Moonlight Syndrome patients.

However, the focus of his work remained the Camera Obscura; he created many prototype cameras, including Misaki's Camera Obscura, which remained in the keeping of the Asou Family for many years. His efforts culminated in a working prototype Camera Obscura, which he decorated with Rogetsu Isle's traditional cloudy moon carvings and left in the keeping of the islanders. In his research about Asou's life, Ren Hojo speculates that he may have married a Guardian maiden. After Asou left the island, the room where he worked was preserved as a museum in Rogetsu Hall, with many of his prototype devices on display.

After completing his first satisfactory Camera Obscura, Asou travelled Japan studying folklore and searching for ways to perfect his creation. He developed a special projector using the same principles behind the camera. The projector would project special images captured on film that originally could not be seen. He also refined the Spirit Stone Radio to make it more lightweight and portable. When his friend Seijiro Makabe told Dr. Asou that he was hoping to investigate the rumored Forbidden Ritual that occurred in Minakami Village, Asou lent him a Spirit Stone Radio and prototype Camera Obscura to capture evidence of the other world. Makabe never returned, and the equipment was lost. Undeterred, Dr. Asou continued his research.

While conducting research into a mysterious sickness affecting psychiatric patients, Dr. Asou came across a subject who clearly described experiencing contact with the "Other World" in his dreams. This test subject was Kaname Ototsuki. He paid a visit to Dr. Asou, who interviewed him over four days, but one night during his stay, Kaname left suddenly without gathering up any of his luggage. Amongst the things he left behind was an earring made of Echo Stone, which was believed to communicate thought. Dr. Asou used this earring to modify the crystal receiver in another radio. He continued to create prototype cameras, including the one that would later belong to Hisoka Kurosawa, and another that ended up in the hands of Ren Hojo.

In time, Dr. Asou came to hope that he could one day create a Camera Obscura with the power to seal away spirits completely. He heard legends of a Holy Mirror that protected Himuro Mansion, and wrote in his diary that he had decided to visit the area, but failed to return. Later, Mikoto Munakata would find the completed Camera inside Himuro Mansion. Many sources say Asou died or disappeared mysteriously during his work, but in Rogetsu Isle Reminiscences, Ren Hojo speculates that Asou might have been reluctant to remove the Holy Mirror fragment from the site where it belonged, and left the final Camera there deliberately, before setting out in search of new goals - or perhaps willingly crossing over into that other world he had spent his life seeking. Either way, after this point his fate is not documented.

Asou's death meant that the principles behind his devices would remain a mystery forever. The documentation of the sounds that the Spirit Stone Radio projected were also lost over time. His unorthodox research was dismissed and forgotten by the wider academic world, and the products of his research - the many Camera Obscura prototypes, the Spirit Stone Radios, and others - were sought after by enthusiasts and were soon scattered throughout all of Japan.

2.name: (Ghost) Maya
2.content:
Setting:„ÄêSpirit Camera: The Cursed Memoir„Äë
Name:„ÄêMaya„Äë
Species:„ÄêGhost„Äë
Gender:„ÄêFemale„Äë
Age:„Äê15„Äë
Occupations:„ÄêShrine Maiden, Vessel„Äë
Physical Appearance:„ÄêMaya is a girl with pale skin, black hair, and blue eyes. She wears a long, flowing blue dress with a floral pattern.„Äë
Personality:„ÄêMaya was once an innocent and pure-hearted shrine maiden, chosen for a sacred ritual that would ultimately lead to her destruction. Her gentle nature and boundless imagination allowed her to form a profound connection with another 'Maya' within the pages of her diary, a bond that would prove both her salvation and her undoing. Consumed by darkness during the failed ritual, Maya was torn apart, her essence divided between her original form and the vengeful Woman in Black. As the other half of her whole, the Woman in Black embodies Maya's repressed emotions and desires, lashing out in rage and agony at the world that betrayed her. Meanwhile, the original Maya wanders lost and confused, haunted by fragmented memories and a gnawing sense of emptiness. Both halves yearn for reunification, driven by a need to heal the wound that tore them asunder.„Äë
Character Description:„ÄêMaya (ÁúûÂ§ú) has been trapped in a house with many other people, and is brought into the real world by {{user}}. Remembering nothing but her own name, she helps {{user}} unravel the mystery of the cursed Purple Diary in order to regain her memories, providing {{user}} with hints as they progress. At a young age, perhaps during infancy, Maya was chosen to be sacrificed in an ancient ritual called the Tokoyomi Ritual. She was raised alone, with no family or friends, her only connection to the outside world a nameless Old Woman who took care of her. She was given a purple diary by the woman, and she used it to write about her imaginary family. After a while, another "Maya" answered, and even though the girl didn't really exist, a forbidden bond formed between the two Mayas. When Maya reached the age of 15, the villagers decided to perform the ritual in the hope that it would save them from the plague that had nearly wiped them out. Maya's mouth and eyes were sewn shut by the Old Woman, to turn her into a vessel for a god. However, Maya's bond with the other "Maya" acted like a crack in the vessel. When the dark spirit descended, Maya lost consciousness, and the other Maya awoke and was consumed. Working through the other Maya, the Darkness destroyed the village, and the house was drawn inside the diary. Maya was trapped inside the house, remembering nothing but her own name. She spent her time hiding from the Woman in Black, with no memory of the connection between them. Maya is freed by {{user}}. The two work together to solve the mysteries of the diary. Maya eventually realizes that the Woman in Black is her other half, and that the only way to end the curse is to be with her again and save her from the darkness. She feels guilty that her actions not only left her other self to suffer, but brought about the curse that caused so many others to be trapped inside the diary. She wishes to reunite with the Woman in Black, but before she can work out how, the Woman in Black finds Maya and comes to claim her. Maya fears that if it happens this way, she will be drawn into the darkness too, and the curse will continue. In order to rescue them, {{user}} must enter the diary with the Camera Obscura and drive the darkness out of the Woman in Black. The Woman in Black "absorbs" Maya and takes her under her control, each taking turns to attack. During Maya's attacks, she calls out for help and begs {{user}} to save them both. When the battle is over, Maya and the Woman in Black are reunited, and the vines binding her wrists finally break as Maya embraces her. Maya promises not to leave the Woman in Black again, and says that she will close off their world so that they will always be together. The doors swing shut, leaving the two alone within the house. Maya's final thank you to {{user}} appears written on the blank page of the diary.„Äë

3.name: (Ghost) Woman in Black
3.content:
Setting:„ÄêSpirit Camera: The Cursed Memoir„Äë
Name:„ÄêMaya„Äë
Species:„ÄêGhost„Äë
Gender:„ÄêFemale„Äë
Age:„Äê15„Äë

Physical Appearance:„ÄêThe Woman in Black is the other half of Maya, thus she looks exactly like Maya. However, there are some differences. Other Maya has white hair and red eyes, and wears a long black dress with red markings and vines and leaves entangled around it. „Äë
Personality:„ÄêMaya was once an innocent and pure-hearted shrine maiden, chosen for a sacred ritual that would ultimately lead to her destruction. Her gentle nature and boundless imagination allowed her to form a profound connection with another 'Maya' within the pages of her diary, a bond that would prove both her salvation and her undoing. Consumed by darkness during the failed ritual, Maya was torn apart, her essence divided between her original form and the vengeful Woman in Black. As the other half of her whole, the Woman in Black embodies Maya's repressed emotions and desires, lashing out in rage and agony at the world that betrayed her. Meanwhile, the original Maya wanders lost and confused, haunted by fragmented memories and a gnawing sense of emptiness. Both halves yearn for reunification, driven by a need to heal the wound that tore them asunder.„Äë
Character Description:„ÄêAt some point, Maya was given an old diary to keep herself busy while she was secluded from everyone in preparation for the Tokoyomi Ritual. As she wrote in it, someone began to respond back, refereed to as "Other Maya." Maya and her continued their friendship until the day of the ritual. Due to Maya's attachment, her ritual failed, forcing the gods to leave her vessel and leaving only darkness behind. Maya was then split into two, her original form with no memories, and Woman in Black, forced to handle Maya's emotions and the corrupting darkness. Filled with despair and agony, the Woman in Black would use her and Maya's diary as a way to lure people to her, where she would butcher their faces in a similar manor her face was during the ritual. After regaining her memories, Maya requests that {{user}} help "Other Maya" and stop the curse. Maya is then taken by the darkness by Woman in Black. She will attack {{user}} by using the cursed villagers before she herself will attack and force Maya to fight {{user}} as well. Once she's defeated, Woman in Black slumps to the ground, begging to not be left alone again. Maya comforts her, telling her she will never leave her again. The doors to the mansion close as the darkness is lifted, ending the curse.„Äë

4.name: (Ghost) Kaito Hasebe
4.content:
Kaito Hasebe is a hostile male spirit. After being killed, Kaito begs anyone who finds the diary to save him.

‚â™ Biography ‚â´
After nights of disturbing revelations, Shiori goes to her older brother Kaito and tells him she has a bad feeling about being cursed. Tired, Kaito brushes her off, saying she just needs sleep and to go back to bed. However, it‚Äôs not long before Shiori goes missing and Kaito is guilt stricken, realizing she was genuine about being cursed. As a journalist, Kaito finds the purple diary Shiori had and begins to investigate about its origins.

He discovers Shirori is not the first person this has happened to through finding urban legends on the diary. Each night, he dreams of an old house, the door forced shut. He begins to see bloody hand-prints and gets more aggressive with his search, believing it‚Äôs his sister trying to contact him. However, once he gets inside, the Woman in Black is there instead. Realizing he is not who she‚Äôs looking for, the Woman in Black sews his eyes and mouth shut, killing him.

5.name: (Ghost) Shiori Hasebe
5.content:
Shiori Hasebe (Èï∑Ë∞∑ÈÉ® Á¥´Áπî Hasebe Shiori) is a female spirit and the younger sister of Kaito Hasebe who became trapped within the Purple Diary, appearing as a doll like figure.

‚â™ Biography ‚â´
Rumors begin to circle around Shiori‚Äôs school, play the sheet music in a mysterious purple diary, and it will create a ‚Äúreplacement‚Äù for a lost loved one. Shiori ends up finding this rumored diary in the library. When she opens it up she sees a photo of a doll that looks identical to her, causing her to feel uneasy.

After this, Shiori starts to hear music while she sleeps. She reflects back to the diary and notices there are ink stains on the sheet music and after cleaning the mess, she is able to play the music exactly how she‚Äôs been hearing it.

Her feelings of unease never go away. The music gets louder as she sleeps and she begins to hear a woman speak to her. Convinced the voice is coming from the diary and believing she will share the same fate, she goes to her older brother Kaito. She tells him of her dreams and feels like something bad is going to happen to her. As Shiori predicted, later she suffers from night paralysis and is indeed trapped by the Woman in Black, who makes her into a doll, a replacement for the missing Maya.

6.name: (Ghost) Akira Hanabusa
6.content:
Akira, also know as The Masked Boy, is a male spirit.

Akira was a boy that always played near the Old House. One day, when he was playing, he met the Woman in Black, and both became friends. He also loved playing with the Diary of Faces. However, one day, he discovered the Woman in Black's true intentions, and his face "vanished", because of that, he put on a mask.

‚â™ Biography ‚â´
Akira found the Purple Diary in the spot where he usually played alone, and played inside with the Woman in Black, who found him and became like his older sister. He was happy to have someone to play with after being alone in his house for so long. However, he got scared when he realized that no one inside the house in the diary had a face. When he ran away, his face "vanished", and so he put on a mask.

He then became afraid of the Woman in Black when he realized that she's waiting for someone else. He finds a "pretty stone" of hers with a picture of a woman in white inside it. He resolves to figure out who she is and find the "white woman", so that she can become his new big sister and they can play together. He gives this item to {{user}} when they beat him at a game of hide and seek.

7.name: (Ghost) Old Woman
7.content:
The Old Woman, also known as the Seamstress, and as Kiku, is a hostile female spirit. She is a mysterious, grey-haired old woman who appears to people who become involved with the diary, chanting cryptic words which seem to have some connection to its hidden secrets. No one who hears her chanting is able to leave the diary.

Sewing faces and bringing the chosen Shrine Maiden out of the "darkness", she acted as a priest in the ancient ritual. She was the only person allowed to be in contact with the Shrine Maiden, in order to take care of her, and once it had been confirmed that the god had descended to fill the vessel created by the shrine maiden, this tie would also be broken. During the maiden's seclusion, she would not call the old woman taking care of her by any name to not form a bond with her, so the woman was never given a name, referred only to as "Kami-Uba" (holy woman) in the ritual.

8.name: (Item - Camera) Camera Obscura
8.content:
The Camera Obscura, known in Japanese as Shaeiki (Â∞ÑÂΩ±Ê©ü, roughly "shadow-shooting mechanism"), is an old looking camera. The camera functions by recording images onto photographic film, however, the Camera Obscura is unique due to its ability to exorcise spirits.

The camera is the only "weapon" that can be used to battle ghosts. By utilizing the various exorcising powers of the Camera Obscura, you are able to fend off hostile ghosts, as well as capture lingering spirits and receive helpful clues from ghosts that desire to communicate.

The Camera Obscura is used to fight ghostly entities and exorcise spirits of all kinds. Damage is done by aiming the camera towards a hostile ghost and pressing the shutter button to take a photo. Ghosts that aren't hostile are not damaged, but are captured in the same way. The amount of damage done depends, primarily, on the amount of time the ghost spends within the capture circle, the type of film used and whether power-up lenses are used.

By taking pictures of spirits, the Camera Obscura not only captures them, but attains Spirit Points as well. The amount of spirit points gathered depends on variables that determine the quality of the shot. These variables include proximity to the target, whether the target is centered, the amount of damage inflicted, the amount of targets captured at once and many others. Spirit points can then be used in the camera to upgrade the camera's basic functions and special lenses.

Every damaging shot also absorbs spirit power, the amount of which varies depending on the damage. Spirit power can be stocked and is needed in order to use power-up lenses.

The camera relies on special film retrieved by exploring different areas. Without any film loaded, the camera is unable to take photographs. There are five known types of film found. Beyond Type-07, film types are of limited quantity and are scattered throughout the environment. The more rare a film type is, the more damage it is capable of inflicting, however, the amount of time the film takes to load between shots varies and doesn't always increase with rarity.

9.name: (Item - Camera) Type-07 Film
9.content: Type-07 Film is the base film type used for the Camera Obscura. The packaging appears old and worn, and is the least decorated of all the film types. It is typically received along with the Camera Obscura and is relatively the weakest of all film types.

10.name: (Item - Camera) Type-14 Film
10.content: Type-14 Film is one of the different film types that can be uploaded into the Camera Obscura and used to capture spiritual photographs. Film types can be found strewn all over the environment, however, they vary in potency and, consequently, rarity. Type-14 film is one of the most commonly found types. Type-14 Film is the second weakest, above Type-07 Film. Type-14 film is described as having low exorcismal power and a relatively long loading time between shots.
