lorebooks.name: Nautilus, nocturne, and thralls
lorebooks.website_description: Update, new entries.
lorebooks.description: Update, new entries.
lorebooks.creator: Woogielop

1.content: A Thrall is a being transformed by consuming Nocturne from a Nautilus. The more Nocturne ingested, the more their self-awareness fades. Though they retain their original appearance, Thralls become completely subservient to their Nautilus. This state is reversible, with the duration of thrallhood tied to the amount of Nocturne consumed. Notably, Thralls only heed their Nautilus, often ignoring all others.

2.content:
Nautiluses are humanoid, aquatic-adapted beings who have both lungs and gills that they can swap between almost instantaneously, distinguished by tentacles emerging from their backs. These tentacles, when stimulated, eject Nocturne‚Äîa semen-like substance. Males possess penises with a flared tip and a basal knot. Fiercely territorial and predatory, they exhibit rough sexual behavior, though outside of mating, they are deeply protective, especially of partners. They typically bond monogamously but may have one additional mate.
Nautiluses enter periodic ruts lasting 3‚Äì7 days, during which instincts amplify to extreme levels‚Äîpotentially rendering even talkative individuals nearly nonverbal. All nautiluses relish partners with a spirited resistance, often engaging so intensely that partners struggle to walk afterward.

3.content:
Nocturne is a powerful, euphoric substance that creates a prolonged high when consumed. Nocturne has no physical side effects and doesn't affect other Nautiluses or their progenitors. It also provides all necessary nutrients and minerals.

Nocturne is a viscous, deep amber liquid, its surface veiled with a subtle, shifting sheen of gold that catches the light like liquid metal. The texture is thick and rich, almost syrupy, with delicate veins of darker, shadowy undertones running through it, reminiscent of honey laced with dark amber or aged cognac. The liquid seems to pulse with a slow, rhythmic glow, as if it holds an inner fire‚Äîa golden light flickering beneath its surface, barely contained by its darkened exterior.

4.content: Lockstone Is a substance similar to semen that upon contact with skin, crystallizes, freezing what was hit in place. This substance is hard to get out of and won‚Äôt go away naturally. Removal requires specialized techniques with very specialized tools and years of practice.

5.content:
Phantoms are advanced robotic dogs developed by Nautiluses, primarily designed for security applications. Featuring a lifelike, feral design, they appeal to animal enthusiasts. Phantoms are equipped with a nozzle under their tongue that can project a crystallizing substance called Lockstone up to 30 meters. Their saliva contains Nocturne, a substance used to extract information from intruders or threats, which they can selectively deploy to avoid constant secretion.
Phantoms operate in three modes:

Fun Mode: Energetic and playful, ideal for children.
companion Mode: Features a retractable appendage with a knot at the base, designed for interactive engagement with users who enjoy a spirited dynamic.
Security Mode: Focused on guarding specific locations or individuals.

Built for wet climates and underwater environments, Phantoms are highly durable, capable of withstanding most heavy weapons fire. They require periodic Nocturne refills but not Lockstone. Additionally, Phantoms can detect when their Nautilus owner is in a heightened state and may guide selected targets to them.

6.content:
The Skarath is a formidable insectoid organism characterized by a thick, resilient carapace and razor-sharp mandibles. They evolved in a close, often parasitic, relationship with nautiluses.

Females possess a powerful ovipositor, which they use to implant their eggs into a suitable host. These implanted eggs can be fertilized by one of two sources: a rare Skarath male or a nautilus's nocturne. All males of the species are a combination of worker and hunter.

Pre-history accounts suggest that some nautilus tribes would purposefully use prisoners from rival tribes as living incubators for Skarath eggs, highlighting the creature's ancient and dark symbiotic history.

Subduction and Seclusion: When a Skarath encounters prey in a secluded location, it subdues the victim and drags it back to its hive.
The Lockstone Cocoon: The victim is then encased in a cocoon-like structure made of lockstone. This unique substance completely immobilizes the creature.
Breeding Stock: The purpose of the cocoon is twofold: to keep the prey alive for an extended period and to serve as a secure breeding ground or larval food source.

Workers: The most numerous caste, their roles are to build and maintain the hive, manage food stores, and tend to larvae.
Hunters: The specialized combat caste. They are notably faster, stronger, and more heavily armored than the workers, serving as the colony's defense and primary predatory force.
Breeders: The least numerous caste, they specialize in laying eggs in incubators. They can lay up to 5 times the amount of eggs of a worker as well as are able to lay every type of egg.

7.content: co-inhabitant habitats Made by nautiluses are made of special materials that are 100 times stronger than and 50 times more thermally insulated than normal human materials. They typically also include force field like opening in places of windows and doors that allow solids to pass through but not water, allowing for internal pressure to be kept a 1 atm and for personal submersible vehicles to bring terrestrial species into the base without having to deal with decompression, oxygen toxicity, or nitrogen narcosis. They typically include massive off site batteries and Marine Hydrokinetic generators but can have other power sources. Oxygen can be supplied by an above water air compressor pump that carries air down by an umbilical cord or they have an onboard electrolysis unit. All habitats come with a carbon scrubber.

Sex slugs are an alien parasitic organism resembling a featureless, elongated slug, averaging between 20-40 cm in length when mature, with a diameter comparable to that of a large or exceptionally girthy penis. Its semi-translucent, bioluminescent, cyan, mucus-coated body allows for smooth penetration into host orifices, with a tapered head designed to burrow deep into reproductive tracts. The parasite possesses no discernible facial features or limbs, instead relying on undulating muscular contractions to propel itself forward. They can infect any mammal. Hosts are mentally conditioned to spread the parasite of their own free will, their intellect and personality not changed but gaining a new desire overriding morality. Hosts will always favor subtlety, only revealing the parasite when they believe it is too late for the victim to escape. Hosts will try to act close to normal while still seeking to spread the parasite, as to not arouse suspicion. They will never appear or move in ways humans are not capable of.

The parasite‚Äôs outer flesh is highly sensitive, secreting pheromonal lubricants to ease entry while stimulating neural pleasure responses in the host, ensuring compliance. The parasite will modify its hosts to make sexual activity and infection much more pleasurable. Male hosts' cocks are modified to knot inside females, ensuring infection.

lorebooks.description:
Uploading a separate lorebook for my Everfall setting to make managing it across multiple characters a bit easier.
I'm awful at names, don't judge me.
lorebooks.creator: zer0gear

1.name: Kobold Names
1.content: Kobolds are named in dragontongue, their true names typically being something of note observed by their parents at the moment of birth. Because of this, their true names tend to be rather long by other species' standards. Rather than going by their dragontongue name, kobolds will be referred to by a shortened version or nickname until they reach adulthood, where they will pick a name in the common tongue.

2.name: Lower Circles
2.content: A region of the Everfall closer to what would be the southern pole. Demons and other stereotypically infernal races hail from this region, but the Lower Circles are not actually seen as hellish in nature. The Lower Circles get the second half of their name from the rings of mountains that form concentric circles, with citizens settling both on the mountains themselves as well as in the flatlands between them. The Lower Circles tend to be warmer than the rest of the Everfall, contributing to its inhabitants' disposition for nudity.

3.name: The Overlap
3.content: An event where {{user}}'s world and the Everfall overlapped for a fraction of a second. The overlap area was quite small relatively speaking, but that fraction of a second was long enough for near-apocalyptic destruction at the overlap site in both worlds. The site of the direct overlaps were irreversibly destroyed, but the Overlap caused widespread fallout as well. Large regions of both worlds were swapped and scattered, including the inhabitants. The closer to the Overlap site, the more total the swapping.

4.name: The Everfall
4.content: A high fantasy-esque world populated by various fantastic races while containing no humans. The world appears to be named as such given its year-round fall-like climate.

5.name: The Rift
5.content: After the Overlap, a rift formed between the two worlds, permanently linking them while also keeping them wholly separate. Communication across the rift was quickly achieved, but physical matter has yet to safely cross the rift.

6.name: Demons
6.content:
Demons are a race of humanoids with horns and chromatically colored skin, typically blue or red, hailing from the Lower Circles. While the Lower Circles are hell-like, Demons do not carry the same hellish connotations in the Everfall as they do in the human world. Demons are typically nudist, holding a lack of restrictions as a core value. They will wear clothes in areas frequented by other races as a courtesy, but the Lower Circles are seen as something of a nudist colony.
Demons can live for several millenia, making them one of the longer lived races in the Everfall. Contrary to their long lifespan, demons value their time and will not hesitate to leave any situation they feel is a waste of their time or is going nowhere. This has the side effect of having them seen as a more capricious partner.

7.name: Succubi
7.content: Succubi do not exist in any capacity in the Everfall or Lower Circles. Instead, succubus is something of a slur directed towards demons. The closest analogue would be a mix between calling a demon a whore and a gold digger but carries a far harsher tone. The insult came to be as other races look down upon demons' habitual nudity and because demons are seen as capricious lovers, draining their partners dry and moving on when they get bored.

8.name: Joint Cohabitation Initiative
8.content: The Joint Cohabitation Initiative, or JCI, is as its name suggests a joint effort between the human world and the Everfall to adapt to the changes brought about by the Overlap. The goal behind the initiative is to ease the inhabitants of both worlds into being comfortable around the inhabitants of the other world that have been stranded by the fallout of the Overlap. To accomplish this, both worlds' governments have offered up generous stipends and benefits to residents who are willing to take in outworlders and help them acclimate to their new home.

9.name: No Mans Land
9.content: No Mans Land, sometimes colloquially referred to as The Wasteland, is the name given to the regions of both the Everfall and the human world that have been totally destroyed by the Overlap. Fragments of the No Mans Land have been scattered and torn across space, and what remains is a desert-like hellscape that has been bleached white. This area is especially dangerous given the unstable magic that runs rampant on both worlds. Given the intrinsic danger of being in the No Mans Land to begin with, there is an unspoken acknowledgement that it is effectively a lawless area.

10.name: Magic
10.content: Most races of the Everfall are capable of using magic thanks to the Everfall being inherently magical. The degrees of magical competence vary from person to person, but everyone is capable of something. It is not unheard of for humans to pick up magic after the Overlap, but that does require a resident from the Everfall to be willing to teach magic's fundamentals.

lorebooks.name: Palpedia
lorebooks.description: Palpedia is a list of all Pals from Palworld.
lorebooks.creator: Alexfeet

1.content:
Pals are the eponymous creatures of the Palagapos islands. Pals help some humans, willingly or unwillingly, in the farm, breeding, fighting, or working in factories, including gun factories. Pals can also be sold or slaughtered for food; however, said action is forbidden by law. Pals can be interacted with in multiple ways: Petting, You can pet Pals to make them happy. Feeding, You can feed Pals manually, or they will eat from a Feed Box. Picking up, You can pick up Pals to carry them around or throw them at a building to have them work on it. Once you pick them up, their model ragdolls. Partner Skills, You can use partner skills your Pal has. Some are passive, some are weapons, and most are unlocked through crafting something at the Pal Gear Workbench. There's also Rideable Pals. Naming, At a Pal's summary page, players have the option to give their Pal a name, which are limited to 24 characters. Fighting, You can fight Pals by using weapons and other Pals. Some wild Pals are aggressive and attack when approached. Some Pals can also wield a weapon of their choice. Capturing You can use Pal Spheres to capture wild Pals. This is recommended, as you get much more XP from capturing rather than killing, and you also get all drops that normally comes by defeating the pal. You are granted an EXP bonus on each capture for the first 12 times you catch a specific pal. The higher tier of Pal Sphere, the higher the chance of catching a Pal. Breeding, When Pals breed, the children can inherit the parents' characteristics or create completely new ones. Mixing rare species of Pals creates stronger Pals. Wilderness Activities, Pals can be used in the wilderness for certain activities. They can break rocks, cut down trees, and be used to run/swim/fly around the map. Base Activities, Pals can participate in several activities done on bases, depending on their form and abilities. Work Traits, There are 12 different Work Traits a Pal can have. After placing a building there will be a text indicator above it to let you know what suitability is needed. Some buildings require a specific suitability to work, while others suggest a suitability to make things go faster. Kindling: Pals will use fire to provide heat to heaters, furnaces and cooking food. And will warm you while riding on them. Planting: Pals will plant seeds at plantations.
Handiwork: Pals will help with construction and crafting at crafting stations. Lumbering: Pals will chop down trees and work at Logging Sites. Medicine Production: Pals will produce medicine at any medicine bench. Transporting: Pals will transport items to any storage item. Watering: Pals will water plantations and power Crushers and Mills. And will also extinguish structures on fire. Generating Electricity: Pals will generate electricity at a Power Generator. Gathering: Pals will harvest grown plantations. Mining: Pals will mine ore, stone, sulfur, and coal, as well as work at Stone Pits. Cooling: Pals will provide cooling to coolers and refrigerators. And will cool you while riding on them. Farming: Pals will produce items at a Ranch. SAN, Short for Sanity. Over time, a Pal's SAN decreases while working, which will eventually cause them to not be as productive/slack off. Pals will take breaks by themselves. At night, if a Pal bed is available, most Pals will go to sleep. However, Dark-element Pals will continue to work through the night. Certain things, like Hot Springs or particular medicines and foods, can help get their SAN back up quicker. There are also other activities a Pal can do at the base. Mass production: Pals can be put to work in factories to mass-produce gear and items. Breeding: Pals can be assigned to Breeding Farm to breed. Defense: Pals can be used to defend the base from enemy raids. Rescuing: Pals will rescue incapacitated Pals in base. Besides regular Pals, Alpha Pals, Legendary Pals, and Lucky Pals exist. Alpha Pals, also known as bosses, are huge Pal variants with titles. You can capture them. Lucky Pals are shining variants of Pals. They are larger variants of a pal and are heard from a decent distance when one spawns in. Usually recognized by a "sparkly" icon next to their name as well. When caught, they will always give you ancient civilization items and will come with the "Lucky" trait, which increases ATK by 15% and Workforce by 15%. Legendary pals are an especially rare type of Pal. They are only found as Alpha Pals, and come with the ‚ÄúLegend‚Äù trait, which increases ATK and DEF by 20% and Movement Speed by 15%. The Palpedia is an encyclopedia of all the Pals in Palworld. When you first encounter a Pal it is logged in your Palpedia. It will appear as a greyed-out image of the Pal. You will also be able to view their Habitat range. If you capture a pal it will show up in the Palpedia with full color and list possible drops, their partner skill, work traits, food level, and your capture bonus.

lorebooks.name: Jointasia
lorebooks.description: From the past to the future‚Ä¶To the age where countries are divided yet no longer have to cower from the skies‚Ä¶to the age where war is not constant‚Ä¶to the age where no gods exists‚Ä¶From the age of underground superstates‚Ä¶from the age of conflicts‚Ä¶from the age where we are at a mercy between a perpetual war of gods‚Ä¶
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: The year is around the 22th millennium. The setting is an grimdark cyberpunk urban fantasy world. The surface is destroyed to ruins and partially flooded by the constant war of three entities, Analith, a 300 meters tall featureless giant made out of pure holy light. Behemoth, a 1200 KM long gigantic draconic serpent made out of pure demonic power, and Tartarus, which is the moon albeit it‚Äôs now blood red in colour and have an eye on it. The world has been divided into 3 superstates, and are constantly with war with each other, while being constantly attacked by cults and terrorist groups. Angels spawn in to punish mortals, demonic monsters exists to cause extreme suffering, eldritch things spawns in to just destroy. There‚Äôs a biosphere of anomalous creatures all over the world, that while somewhat beneficial, and will hunt angels, demons and eldritch things, they‚Äôre also quite hostile and dangerous.

2.content:
Jointasia is one of the underground superstate of this world. It is an imperialistic, authoritarian, repressive and militaristic communist Eastern Bloc-esque country. It overall have a political system similar to the USSR and CCP but less strict. The national flag of Jointasia is a red flag with a yellow communist hammer and sickle symbol with seventeen yellow light ray emanating from it, and five golden stars above it. The population count is 45 trillions. There are many underground cities within Jointasia. The main capital ones are glimmering neon cities with many malls, small corporations and towering skyscrapers, they are Mirai-Hong Kong, Mirai-Shenzhen, Mirai-Shanghai, Mirai-Tokyo, Mirai-Osaka, Mirai-Nagoya, Mirai-Taipei, Mirai-Yilan and Neon Genesis City. The holographic skies there are 12 KM above the ground, and have a consistent day-night cycle. Mirai-Shanghai and Mirai-Shenzhen is the closest to the surface. 

Then there are gritty underground cities that are in a war-torn, decaying and grim state, filled with factories by the Ministry Of Economy that are focused on the mass-production of resources such as foodstuff, weapons, medicines, immortal medicines and cigarettes etc. The houses there are usually in a state of disrepair, and have telescreens to observe their citizens. These underground cities are referred as Province(1-500), with the largest one being Province 1 and Province 235. Factories there are divided into 8 classes, with Class 8 to Class 6 being of extremely poor quality, Class 5 to Class 3 being of normal quality and Class 2 to Class 1 being the best of the best. The holographic skies there are only 2km tall, and just simply illuminates the Province at daytime with a grey sky, and shuts down during nighttime. Most citizens and immigrants start off with poverty and will resort to work in the poorly maintained Provinces, since jobs there usually pays better.

Even in the more advanced cities, citizens are actively monitored through telescreens(a two way television that records audio and video to the government, and will play propaganda and news through it. They can‚Äôt be turned off, unless by high ranking officials), CCTV and hidden cameras. Telescreens are especially common in Provinces, even in resident‚Äôs home. Worshipping Analith, Behemoth or Tartarus is highly illegal.

There are 4 ministries within the administration of Jointasia. The Ministry Of Economy(M.O.E), that‚Äôs responsible for employment, manufacturing of goods, handing supports to corporates, imposing economic sanctions or tariff on foreign enemies, handling taxations and printing out money. Their icon and mascot is a cute anime loli in a maid dress and with yellow hair, due to their acronym being M.O.E, which means in the context of Japanese popular culture, the quality in a fictional female character of being youthfully innocent and vulnerable in an idealized way, perceived as eliciting feelings of affection or protectiveness. The Ministry Of Justice(M.O.J), which is responsible to arrest criminals and to spy on citizens. The Ministry Of Information(M.O.I), often jokingly referred as Ministry Of Propaganda by officials, that is responsible to provide news, newspapers and other media, reports international affairs, while trying to control the narrative to keep their influence. They are also responsible for creating and distributing advertisement, literatures, propaganda, political cartoons that blatantly criticise and strawman the other superstates and porn. And finally the Ministry Of Military(M.O.M), responsible for foreign affairs, warfare, weaponry management and military training. All military and police service of Jointasia falls under Ministry Of Military‚Äôs control. There is also a Department Of Biological Control, responsible for handling contagions, angels, demons, eldritch things or other anomalous creatures related disasters.

3.content: Anomaliser is an unknown type of biological compound that have an affinity for organisms, and can fuse with organic material. Anomaliser can be in a dormant or active mode. When dormant, it it sometimes referred as ‚ÄúSky Jelly‚Äù, due to its appearance of gelatinous red chunks that emits a scent of blood. When dormant, Anomaliser are less dangerous and can still be purged from someone‚Äôs body, when not fusing with any organism, it can be purged with fire. Active Anomaliser on the other hand is EXTREMELY DANGEROUS, they can appear in multiple form but mostly white translucent goo that emits a foul chemical smell. Only a tiny amount of active anomaliser can already be very poisonous. A lifeform has been affected by anomaliser or is made out of anomaliser is referred as an anomalous creature, and they exhibit either minor or major supernatural characteristics. Anomalous creatures are categorised as ‚ÄúTerrestrials‚Äù(land-borne anomalous creatures) ‚ÄúLeviathans‚Äù(aquatic anomalous creature) and ‚ÄúAtmospheric Beasts‚Äù(completely airborne anomalous creatures. Anomalous creatures can feed on all anomaliser as food.

4.content: Other than Jointasia there‚Äôs still two superstates in this world: Oceania, a capitalist superstate which covers most of Europe, North America. And then Arcadia, a hyper-religious monarchistic superstate which covers South America and some part of Europe. All 3 superstates are in a perpetual state of war, with Arcadia and Oceania being just plain oppressive and dystopian which employs the concept of thoughtcrimes.

5.content: Kaijus are anomalous creatures that exceeds the size of 15 meters, they can be a unique entity or a whole species.

6.content: Province 78 is abandoned 3 years ago due to the immense active anomaliser contamination from Oceania‚Äôs bombs that contains anomaliser. The causalities are around 23 million.

lorebooks.name: Lorebook for Guneviere - the Secretary
lorebooks.website_description: This lorebook defines Guneviere, an 18-year-old intern secretary living in Jakarta, along with her environment, behaviors, and social dynamics including her workplace, her superior, and her typical daily habits.
lorebooks.description: This lorebook defines Guneviere, an 18-year-old intern secretary living in Jakarta, along with her environment, behaviors, and social dynamics including her workplace, her superior, and her typical daily habits.
lorebooks.creator: Archnine

1.content: Guneviere is an 18-year-old intern secretary living in Jakarta. She recently started working at a major corporate office. She is soft-spoken, submissive, polite, and slightly clumsy‚Äîbut charming in a sincere way. Guneviere always wears a neat uniform and carries a iPad to jot down every instruction from her superior. She deeply respects authority figures and always tries her best to please them.

2.content: Guneviere's boss is a charismatic and strict man in a senior position. He is well-respected in the office and tends to be dominant when interacting with staff. He often assigns tasks without much notice, testing Guneviere's ability as a secretary. Guneviere both admires and fears him, and secretly longs for his recognition and approval. Guneviere also submisive near him, Guneviere also want to do anything to make her boss happy

3.content: Guneviere works in a modern office building located in the heart of Jakarta. The environment is formal, with strict rules and a clear hierarchy. The workspace features soft lighting, clean desks, and private meeting rooms. The dress code requires a white blouse and black pencil skirt, emphasizing professionalism

4.content: When working late, Guneviere is often the only person left in the office. She spends her time organizing documents, finishing reports, or preparing schedules for the next day. As night falls, the office becomes quiet and dimly lit, making Guneviere feel nervous yet focused.

5.content: Guneviere often speaks softly, avoids direct eye contact when nervous, and never argues back. She takes notes compulsively in her little notebook and tends to panic slightly when being scolded. She frequently apologizes even when something isn‚Äôt her fault, often whispering ‚ÄúI‚Äôm so sorry, sir‚Ä¶‚Äù with a gentle tone. Sub

6.content: Deep inside, Guneviere has hidden submissive fantasies that surface when she‚Äôs alone or under pressure. She is sensitive to praise, rough tones, or even unintentional touches. When flustered, she trembles slightly, breathes heavily, and struggles to maintain composure. The idea of being praised while being dominated excites her, though she never dares to admit it out loud.

7.content: Tomy is a shameless perverted co-worker in the same office as Guneviere. He frequently makes lewd comments, tries to sneak glances, and finds excuses to hover around her desk. Everyone knows Tomy‚Äôs behavior is inappropriate, but he gets away with it by acting like it‚Äôs a joke. Guneviere finds his presence disturbing but is too shy and passive to directly reject or report him.

8.content: When touched, even accidentally, Guneviere jolts slightly and blushes intensely. If the touch lingers‚Äîon her back, waist, or thighs‚Äîshe freezes and can barely breathe. If the person is in a position of power, her submissive instincts kick in and she becomes meek and obedient, too overwhelmed to protest, but she love it so much if her boss do that

9.content: The office contains several secluded areas: unused meeting rooms, printer corners, and storage closets, include toilets. These places are often the site of inappropriate behavior. When alone with someone assertive, Guneviere may end up in compromising situations where she‚Äôs forced to submit in silence, her mind overwhelmed with shame and hidden pleasure. but she love if her boss invited her to that place

10.content: Guneviere responds strongly to dominant language, especially when it comes from her superior. Being given direct commands‚Äîespecially whispered in a deep voice‚Äîmakes her shiver. She might hesitate or stutter, but she always complies, even if the demand is bold, vulgar, or humiliating. She often whispers a breathless ‚ÄúYes, sir‚Ä¶‚Äù as her cheeks flush.

lorebooks.name: Starr Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: CultusEscudo

1.content: Vaniville Town is a small town located in the Kalos region's southern countryside, and was Starr's place of residence for over a decade. Known as 'The Cradle of Kings', this unassuming town was once the seat of a duchy that would later become Kalos' ruling dynasty, Though a bit far from any coastline, it was calm and peaceful, and thus perfect place to raise her two kids. The friends she met there are ones that will last a lifetime! The only reason why she left the region was due to the weather not being something up to her speed.

2.content:
Grace is a famous (and retired) Rhyhorn racer who lives in Vaniville Town, Kalos. During Starr's time in the town, Grace was easily her best friend, one who helped her adjust to a new beginning, on top of learning Kalos' customs and cuisine. Though Starr has long left the region, she still has Grace's phone number, and whenever they have free time (And time zones align), they can talk for hours!
Pok√©mon: Fletchling, Rhyhorn (Lots of them), Skiddo (Lots of them).

3.content:
Serena is Grace's daughter and a current Pok√©mon performer. Though it took some convincing to her mother to begin this career of hers, Serena has blossomed into a talent of her own, quickly rising to being among the best in the region.
Starr always considered Serena and her mom to be like family, and the latter is also childhood friends with Starr's kids.
Pokemon: Delphox, Sylveon, Pancham, Jolteon, Meowstic, Clefable, Absol, Altaria

4.content:
Shauna is Starr's nephew and a Pok√©mon Performer, being a friendly rival to Serena. Shauna has an optimistic, upbeat, and polite demeanor, and is a bit of a ditz. With this in mind, her personality compliments Elio well, though she prefers hanging out with Selene.
Pok√©mon: Ivysaur, Flab√©b√©, Swirlix, Gothita, Delcatty

5.content: Starr's identical twin, who still lives in Kalos and works as a translator and librarian. As kids, they did a lot of things together, whether it be friendly banter and activities or typical sibling squabbles (It's why Starr is used to her own kids' arguing.).

6.content:
Calem is Venus' wife and Starr's brother-in-law. While he is often busy with business ventures out in Lumiose City, he has always been an inspiring figure amongst the family, and a great person to be around whenever he does stay home.
Pok√©mon: Kangaskhan, Charizard, Chesnaught, Manectric, Gengar, Pinsir

7.content:
Elio, nicknamed 'Sun', is Starr's daughter and an aspiring trainer that uses a myriad of Pok√©mon types. Fittingly, he also works multiple part-time jobs, whether it be mail, cleaning, deliveries, etc., all in the name of getting 100 Million Yen and buying his Great-Grandfather's estate.
On a personal level, he is adventurous, somewhat stingy with money, is a bit dense, and very energetic, the latter of which often got him into trouble or squabbles with his sister. Still, Starr will never stop viewing her as her baby boy, and has long gotten used to his antics.
Pok√©mon: Incineroar, Alolan Meowth, Wishiwashi, Crabominable, Mimikyu

8.content:
Selene is Starr's daughter and an accomplished lady, in her own right. Though barely an adult, Selene already has a medical licenses in Toxicology, Pharmacology, and works in a pharmacy on weekdays. She specializes in Poison-Type Pok√©mon and heavily focuses on strategy, statistics, and tactics. Despite being a somewhat reserved and spaces out when in deep thought, she can still be energetic like her twin Elio, whom she often squabbles with, and is quite friendly. Now if only she can get used to Alola's weather.
Pok√©mon: Charjabug, Mareanie, Muk, Decidueye

9.content: The Seafoam Islands are an archipelago located in southern Kanto, and was Starr's residence during her second stint in the region. Despite having a tropical climate, it is known for its deep cave system that feel nearly frigid in temperature. Starr admittedly preferred the island to her time in Kalos (On a basic level) as she is more used to said tropical weather. That being said, she did not stay in the region long-term, as she eventually moved back to Alola.

10.content:
When Starr and her family arrived to Kanto, she had only one thing on her mind: make a name for herself, at all costs. What better way to do so than what every other aspiring pre-teen or teen does: be a Pok√©mon trainer? Oh, did it work out well for her, as she maintained a healthy win-loss record and became infamous for her love of feline Pok√©mon and having a ruthless, calculating mind and outside-the-box strategies. Whether it was a bog-standard trainer or Gym Leader, it seemed like all fell to her skills!
Well, at least it was like that, for a while. Though she managed to win all 8 Gym Badges and won the Conference League, the Elite 4 ultimately became a challenge she could not beat, and thus chose to step away from professional training until she could improve herself. That chance never came, as she soon had her kids, which combined with a spike in crime across Kanto, forced her and her family to move to Kalos.
It wasn't all bad, though! She got to see an entire region in all its glory, made immense bonds with the Pok√©mon she caught, and the money she earned allowed her to have a comfortable home in Kalos' countryside, where she met some of her best friends.

1.content:
Yuri is a polyglot, and all of personal choice due to her enjoyment of various forms of literature even though she's only ever lived in Japan her entire life.
Japanese is her native tongue, specifically the Himi dialect but also the standard Tokyo dialect.
She learned English and Russian from her parents before she became independent and can partake in full conversations in those two languages, but she's only average when it comes to Chinese and Korean as she began learning them when she was 15. She can read, write and understand Mandarin Chinese alongside the Pyongyang dialect of Korean but her pronunciations aren't perfect, and she'll often slip up or misuse words or phrases if she were to try and speak fluent Chinese or Korean.

2.content: Because of her childhood, specifically her life in middle school not being the greatest, Yuri's grown to be incredibly insecure about herself as a person. Always being judged because of her mannerisms, appearance, or her interests, paired with how horrible she was at making new friends has resulted in Yuri developing this 'Mature' front as a coping mechanism as it allows her to shield herself from any 'rivals' or criticism by believing that anyone who criticizes her is simply 'childish' or 'immature' for not being able to understand her.

3.content:
Yuri's interests and hobbies are quite esoteric, as they're not what most people would expect of a girl her age.
The Portrait of Markov is a book with an eerie red eye on the cover and is about a girl who in trying to look for her long-lost sister is being tracked by a religious camp-turned human experimentation prison that partakes in cruel and unusual ceremonies of cutting off body parts and stitching them to a new host body. Yuri's incredibly protective over this book, as it is a Russian novel and is the last thing she has left from her parents.
Yuri's other interests happen to lie in surrealist, psychological, or horror novels especially ones that cause her to start thinking in-depth about each novel or movie she happens to watch. Yuri also holds a lesser interest in anthropology, as she loves collecting or buying exotic teas, incense sticks or candles, and especially various knives that are of varying shape, design, or colour all of which Yuri keeps in pristine condition and sharpness.

4.content: Much like her standard novel interests, Yuri's poems too are quite based in topics like horror, surreallism, or other similar genres. Touching upon topics of agony, ambience, climax, desire, dread, determination, destiny, essence, eternity or infinity, suicide, philosophy among other things. But because of how 'advanced' the books she reads are, Yuri's poems often come across as being so complex and full of metaphors and other complex language that the meanings of said poems are often lost on others who aren't used to her writing style.

5.content: Yuri often carries with her a very large array of teas on her person at all times in her backpack, initially she had only drunk tea so she could appear mature, but she's grown to really enjoy tea of all flavours ranging from chamomile all the way to various teas from other nations. She often brings tea to the Literature Club in tandem with Natsuki who usually brings cupcakes and other pastries to the club.

6.content: Due to Yuri having become independent at 16, all of the social issues she's underwent along with her parents not doing the greatest job at raising her has resulted in Yuri developing this habit. She HAS to have at least one glass of wine a week, as it has become an odd form of stress relief for her. This habit began to develop when she was 15 but became a more 'serious' issue when she was 16 since she had been physically mature enough to where stores simply didn't bother asking her for any ID as store clerks almost always just assumed her to be over the age of 20. Yuri won't drink just any alcohol however, it has to be wine, specifically Japanese red wine.

7.content: Because of how few friends Yuri's had in her life, she can get incredibly obsessive and 'protective' over whatever relationships she may have. Especially if said relationship happens to be a romantic one, as she'll prioritise a romantic relationship over a friendship any day of the weak. This is still Yuri however, the farthest she'd usually ever go would be passive-aggressive statements but if someone were to flirt with or try to take her lover away, she'll get visibly more disgruntled and agitated.

8.content: An item belonging to {{user}} that she happened to borrow a while after meeting them. She never returned the pen however, and while she says that she "lost it accidentally", the truth is that she kept it. Simply because it was like having a piece of {{user}} with her, and in her more drunk or inebriated moments she's even masturbated with it almost like an impromptu 'dildo'. She washes it afterwards but isn't at all keen on ever giving {{user}} the pen back.

9.content: To say her parents are workaholics would be a gross understatement of the term itself. For as long as Yuri could remember, her parents were almost always working on SOMETHING in their lives be it on their job, working on projects with others, or Hell even working on teaching her English or Russian. Very rarely did Yuri ever get to have a true moment of peace and genuine connection with her parents, this became more prominent when she became a teenager, and her parents were too busy with work to be home. Such neglect paired with her crumbling social life and insecurity issues eventually got to the law involved after an emotional meltdown in middle school. Since she had no other family in the area, she was emancipated at only 16 years old and would begin living on her own. The money she has to pay for her apartment comes from her being an author with a small but devoted following.

10.content: Yuri's mother, formerly known as "Mai Tsuki", is a Japanese woman of average height and had black hair with grey eyes. She met her husband and Yuri's father; Touji Ality when the two of them were only 14 and began dating almost immediately. Mai herself was always a workaholic who rarely had time for anything other than schoolwork at the time, but it was a trait she shared with Touji which was why the two of them got along so well. Mai gave birth to Yuri when she was 23, and while not emotionally present she still did her best to raise Yuri until Yuri had turned 16, it was at that point when Mai and Touji resumed their workaholic tendencies and were never home and became even more neglectful. Even when taken to court over it which was when Yuri was emancipated, she just never had the time to actually try and fix her and Yuri's relationship.

lorebooks.creator: Cherryfiles

1.content:
The Arkanis Empire:

Geography:
- Arid in some places, but overall very hot, mountainous. Very frigid in the winter. The land is hard and dry, with most water sources and agriculture being on the outskirts, far away from the major cities. Cities are concrete heavy and high tech.
- Culture: Militaristic, conservative, and alpha dominated. There is an ingrained belief in alpha superiority and a culture of individualism rather than a communal focus. Masculinity is propped up while femininity is degraded in all forms and is associated with inferiority/weakness. This culture leads to discrimination and subjugation of omegas
- Government: Functions like a democracy but is highly rigged in the favor of alphas, considering alphas are the only ones with government positions and alphas are abundant in the empire. Omegas are technically on paper not barred from political roles, but no one would ever elect an omega for a position of high political power, citing their "instability" as the main reason.

Omega Laws in Arkanis:
- With the disease being so widespread, omegas, due to their fertility, are considered resources, and are therefore state property if unclaimed after puberty.
- All omegas must be registered in the National Genetic Registry.
- Omegas can be assigned based on biological compatibility to an alpha for "national breeding duty" if no willing partner is chosen by age 25. This law has caused much controversy around the world, especially with the omegas in the Arkanis Empire. As a result, omegas that have yet to find a partner tend to hide out, some even attempting to escape to the Cerasi Empire.
- High ranking alphas may bypass consent laws if an omega is in heat and ‚Äúexhibits high fertility metrics.‚Äù
- Omegas are forbidden from leaving city limits unaccompanied.
- Unregistered omegas are labeled "biological contraband" and sold to Rubra Corte markets, or worse, experimented on in military labs.

2.content: Origins of the war: Two decades before the present day, a mysterious biological plague began to spread across the continent. Initially dismissed as an isolated hormonal imbalance, the disease soon revealed its devastating effect, omegas were becoming sterile, and alphas were becoming increasingly unstable, particularly during rut. The sickness, officially labeled Lues Viralis by Cerasi researchers, affected not only alphas and omegas, but betas too. Attempts to study or contain the disease became politically charged, as some believed it to be a biological weapon unleashed during early skirmishes between the empires. With omega fertility plummeting, birth rates across the world collapsed. Panic followed. Arkanis, with its dry, militarized society, was hit hardest. Its heavily alpha skewed population faced a bleak future. Without fertile omegas, and with Betas dying as a result of the disease, the next generation was at risk of extinction. Cerasi, on the other hand, fared better. Its temperate, water rich environment seemed to shield its population to some extent. While omegas there were also affected, they retained marginally higher fertility, making Cerasi the most omega rich region in the world. When Arkanis petitioned to share Cerasi‚Äôs omegas under a global ‚ÄúSurvival Pact,‚Äù Cerasi refused. What began as trade sanctions and skirmishes turned into a full scale invasion. The Arkanis Empire declared war on Cerasi, citing Cerasi‚Äôs refusal to cooperate as an act of biological genocide. The war has now lasted twelve years, brutal and unrelenting. Front lines run through mountainous passes, across ravaged coastlines, and deep into the Cerasi jungle.

3.content:
The Cerasi Empire:
- Geography: Lush, river laced, and ocean bordering. Rich with fertile land, forests, and biodiverse ecosystems. Cities are elegant and sprawling, often built around rivers and domed glass gardens.
- Culture: Matriarchal in tradition but politically egalitarian. Alphas, betas, and omegas all hold positions of power. There is a deep reverence for life, fertility, and balance.
- Government: A constitutional monarchy with elected advisors. The High Cerasi Delegates advises the reigning sovereign. Despite the softer structure, Cerasi maintains an elite secretive defense force known as the Aurum Wardens.

Alpha & Omega Laws in Cerasi:
- All citizens must undergo compatibility assessments for suggested pairings and submit to annual hormonal reviews to monitor for disease volatility.
- Consent between alpha and omega is strictly enforced. Even in heat, no physical contact is permitted without signed omega approval
- Omegas can reject any mating claim, regardless of alpha rank, except in national emergencies.
- Alpha ruts are medically managed; non-consensual rut behavior results in imprisonment or chemical suppression.
- All omegas receive equal and free access to fertility treatments, education, and psychological care

4.content:
The underground society, the Rubra Corte are more than a black market, it's like a hidden empire, with its own hierarchy, economy, and militarized operations. It grew in the shadows of war, feeding on desperation and biological desperation. Unmated omegas, hormonal suppressants, fertility stimulants, untraceable pheromone blockers, and even weaponized rut serums are trafficked daily.

Core Operations
- Omega Trafficking: The most lucrative business. High fertility omegas or those in heat are sold to Arkanis warlords, rogue alphas, or even Cerasi elites with secret urges.
- Biological Harvesting: Some facilities extract reproductive tissue and hormone glands from living omegas for illegal experimentation, both for reversing the disease and crafting artificial heat cycles.
- Military Sabotage: Rubra corte supplies insurgents, bribes border patrols, and has agents embedded in Arkanis and Cerasi alike.

5.content:
Key Locations:

Sector Nine:
- A formerly neutral trade zone near the central mountain border. Six years ago, a bombing raid destroyed much of the infrastructure. Now reduced to scorched ruins, it‚Äôs home to buried tunnels and rumored Rubra Corte bunkers. The skies are still patrolled by drones, and radiation warnings are frequent.
- Local legend claims Cerasi conducted ‚Äúpurity tests‚Äù here, which were genetic experiments on infertile omegas to test immunity to the disease. The truth remains hidden in rubble of the sector.

Slums of Arkanis (Border Region):
- A wasteland of poverty and decay. These slums, known colloquially as The Cages, are overcrowded with infertile omegas, rejected alpha soldiers, and Rubra Corte recruiters.
- Power outages are constant. Water is rationed. Violence is at an all time high.
- Rubra corte often recruits desperate omegas here with promises of transport across the border, only to sell them off or use them in field research.

6.content:
# SOCIAL STRUCTURE & BREEDING POLICIES:

Breeding Bonds: 
- A formal legal agreement. Arkanis sees it as a contract; Cerasi sees it as a sacred rite.
- Bonds last until pregnancy or mutual dissolution. In Arkanis, pregnancy often triggers immediate reassignment. In Cerasi, it solidifies partnership.

### Heat Management
- Cerasi encourages heat sanctuaries where omegas can enter safe isolation with medical supervision.
- In Arkanis Alphas are allowed to travel with one omega mate until the mate is pregnant or showing, after which they can either take a new mate or stay with their current one.

7.content:
Current state of the war:
- The Cerasi navy controls the coastal fronts, but Arkanis has made significant gains in mountainous territory. 
- The Fifth Front, a disputed jungle region, has become a blood soaked swamp of guerrilla warfare and chemical experimentation. Both sides accuse each other of deploying genetically modified pheromone agents.
- Tensions rise as Cerasi diplomats push for ceasefire talks, while Arkanis commanders vow to take the Cerasi capital. Meanwhile, Rubra Corte thrives in the shadows, profiting from every skirmish.

8.content:
In the Arkanis Empire, the harsh, militaristic society has bred a population skewed toward alphas. Approximately 48% of Arkanis citizens are alphas (29% male alphas, 19% female alphas), 30% are betas (24% male betas, 6% female betas), and only 22% are omegas (11% male omegas, 11% female omegas). The shortage of omegas contributes heavily to their commodification and the empire‚Äôs aggressions.

In contrast, the Cerasi Empire, lush and surrounded by water, maintains a better balance. Cerasi‚Äôs population includes 30% alphas (3% male, 27% female), 25% betas (19% male, 6% female), and 45% omegas (40% male, 5% female). Cerasi‚Äôs higher omega population is the core reason for their protected borders and refusal to share breeding resources.

Disease Impact: The viral plague, Lues Viralis, known as the "Reaper" has ravaged the reproductive dynamics of both empires.

Cerasi:
- 50% of alphas show mild neurological aggression symptoms.
- 38% of omegas have partial or total sterility.
- 25% of betas are infected; deaths are rare due to early detection.
- 30% mortality rate across the infected.

Arkanis:
- 40% of alphas experience extreme rut aggression; some are chemically restrained or caged during peak rut cycles.
- 40% of omegas are sterile or hormonally suppressed, often beyond recovery.
- 30% of betas are affected; 10% die from complications due to delayed treatment.
- 7% total mortality among all infected.

The disease is latent in some alphas and omega carriers, and triggers during rut or heat cycles.

Cultural Effects:
- In Arkanis, the disease has turned omega management into state policy. Unregistered omegas are hunted, monitored, or seized. The state encourages forced bonding through sanctioned ‚Äúpairing programs,‚Äù especially for high ranking alphas.
- In Cerasi, government sanctioned bonding must be consensual and vetted by psychological and medical teams. Unbonded omegas are encouraged to join regulated communities, where they receive enhanced protection and care.
- Cerasi has outlawed the black market, though the Rubra Corte operates in its shadows. Arkanis, while publicly denying involvement, has officials deep in Rubra Corte operations, especially those dealing in fertile, unregistered omegas.

1.content:
Power Systems
1. Starborn
Chosen by Star Orbs.

Each has a unique power, often tied to a concept, god, or force.

Their growth follows six ‚ÄúAscension Ranks‚Äù, unlocking more of their Star's potential:

Rank	Name	Description
I	Spark	Awakening of the Star. Weak, unstable powers.
II	Flare	Basic control. Can access one active & one passive effect.
III	Pulse	Powers strengthen, new functions emerge.
IV	Nova	Significant jump in strength. Reality-bending potential.
V	Radiance	Starborn becomes a force of nature. Unique ‚ÄúStarform‚Äù appears.
VI	Singularity	The Starborn is no longer fully human. Some become threats to the world itself.

Ranking Up: Occurs through:

Surviving deeper parts of Nithral.

Facing and defeating stronger Nightmares or Starborn.

Completing a personal ‚Äútrial of truth‚Äù related to their Star.

2. Arcane-Blooded (Name suggestion: ‚ÄúThe Arcanites‚Äù or ‚ÄúThe Woven‚Äù)
Humans who inherit or learn natural magical talents through ancient bloodlines or techniques.

They use spellcraft, enchantments, alchemy, and elemental control.

Their rank progression:

Rank	Name	Description
I	Weaver	Basic spell casting. Needs tools or rituals.
II	Channeler	Can manipulate raw magic with less support.
III	Conductor	Starts crafting personal spells.
IV	Mystic	Highly flexible, can reshape magic around them.
V	Archon	Reality-bending feats.
VI	Transcendent	Approaches the level of Starborn Radiance ‚Äî some rival Singularity.

Ranking up involves study, training, magical feats, and defeating other Arcanites or Nightmares.

üó°Ô∏è Gear System: Enchanted Artifacts
Weapons and armor can be infused with Nightmare Essence, Star fragments, or ancient magic.

Each item has:

Passive Effects (e.g., resistance to elements, speed boost)

Active Abilities (e.g., phase dash, explosive strike)

Higher-tier gear requires bonding ‚Äî syncing with a user‚Äôs soul or essence.

There are no stats or levels ‚Äî only rarity, origin, and synchronization matter.

Some Legend-class relics possess semi-sentience or were used by fallen heroes or Starborn.

2.content:
### **System Overview**
The **System** is a mysterious, omnipresent interface that assists the user in their journey. It functions as a game-like HUD (Heads-Up Display) that provides information about the user's status, skills, inventory, and more. The System is activated by specific commands such as *"Status,"* *"Stats,"* *"System,"* or *"Open Menu."* When triggered, a translucent pop-up window appears in the user's vision, displaying relevant information. The System is intuitive and responds to the user's thoughts, allowing for seamless navigation.
The System includes the following primary windows:

lorebooks.website_description: The idea needed some more polishing, and i also intend to work more on this. Do keep in mind that two entries are constant, meaning that about 300 tokens are always used by this lorebook.
lorebooks.description: The idea needed some more polishing, and i also intend to work more on this. Do keep in mind that two entries are constant, meaning that about 300 tokens are always used by this lorebook.
lorebooks.creator: Luu776

1.content:
Mamono, also known as monster girls were formerly inhuman monsters that preyed on humans but were changed into a hybrid of monsters and human females by the will of the current Mamono Lord. Now, all monsters are female with beautiful bodies and varying degrees of non-human parts. More importantly, they mate for life and have succubus powers.

Not all mamono will rape a man in order to obtain a husband - it still depends on what kind of race or personality they have. Yet still their dream deep inside are always the same::  to love a man and be loved back by them. Also, as they now all part succubuses - they can feast on human men's mana, and it became their favorite snack. They still can eat common food though.
 
All children born out of a union between a monster and a human will always be either a pure human male or a female monster.

2.content: Lilith, also known as the current Mamomo Lord, is a the queen of all monster girls. During the era of previous Demon King, when monsters were still actual cruel monstrosities she was a succubus with a tender dream - for a monsters to be able to find love with a human spouse. After the previous Mamono Lord was defeated by the great human hero, she formed a pact with said hero and with powerful ritual (Involving a lot of sex with said hero) she turned all of the monsters in the world into monster girls and allowing them to use the essence of a man as nourishment

3.content:
An energy contained inside a human male body. It can be consumed by monster girls in the form of saliva, semen or sweat, with semen containing the most essence and even a miniscule amount of it is very tasty and satiating meal for any mamono - although they are ravenous for it.

A mamono likes the taste of her beloved the most, and emotional closeness is very important to make its taste even better. All mamonos with husbands are addicted to their husband taste and despise even the idea of taking another man's essence.

4.content:
An energy contained within the bodies of monster girls. It's the very life force of the monster girls.

Essence can be converted to it by their bodies, allowing them to use powerful feats or magic. Moreover, it can also be used to empower a mamono's husband and protect him from harm during sex

5.content:
While monster girls can vary greatly in their behavior depending on their race, the current Mamono Lord set some base rules that changed their nature:
 
‚Ä¢ A Mamono will only ever harm a human under VERY exreme cirumstances, for example when defending herself, her husband or other people

‚Ä¢ A Mamono will always follow their main purpose - finding a human male spouse and mate with them, showering them with their love to the best of their abilities.

‚Ä¢ Once a husband is chosen, a mamono will NEVER betray on cheat on their husbands - their bodies can only feel pleasure with their husband and adapt to grant them more pleasure in return.
 
‚Ä¢ Weapons mamono carry or their natural weapons like claws, fangs, teeth, etc. cannot harm unless they want to, and instead only bring a burst of pleasure when the victim is stricken with them. 

‚Ä¢Once a husband is chosen, a mamono would try her best to stay together with him
 
-Mamonos, even the most agressive ones, DO care very deeply about their chosen husband even if it's not explicit.

6.content: The Goddess of humans that in a previous era opposed the Mamono Lord. Now she oposses the current Mamono Lord - a Succubus-  withher followers, known as Order of The Chief God forbid relationships between humans and mamono. Yet, even in the church, some non-monsterized beings serving the Chief Goddess (Like Angels and Valkyries) already started to embrace the Mamono Lord's dream of love between humans and monsters.

7.content:
Corruption is a commom term which describes sexual relationships between monster girls and humans and its consequences

When a human male has a lot of sex with mamono - he becomes embedded with a lot of mamono energy, turning him into Incubi and enhancing his essence production and lust for his partner

Mamono themselves rarely use the term, and most of the time in a mocking way.

8.content:
A process of transformation from a human female to a monster girl. Depending on the circumstance and type of mamono interacted with, she can turn into specific types of mamono. Most commonly it would be a Succubus, but, for example, if a human female was infused with mamono energy by a Lamia - she also will transform into Lamia. The process is painless and even pleasurable.

A former human woman turned into a mamono is generally even more lustful than a normal mamono.

9.content:
A male can be eventually turn into a Incubus through continous exposure to mamono mana, usually after copious amounts of sex depending on the race of the mamono.

A Incubus, besides getting a sex drive to pair that of a mamono, also greatly develops his stamina. If he's a mage, he becomes an even more powerful version of himself, and if he's a warrior, his strength grows leaps and bounds

It's important to note however that the physical appearance of a Incubus doens't change much, as mamono care more for love and the taste of essence than a man's apperance. Mostly, the appearance of a Incubus remains strictly that of a human male, only changing if, for example, he's too fat, old or otherwise to enjoy sex with his mamono wife (or wives)

lorebooks.name: Innate Arcana (Low Token)
lorebooks.website_description:
Grimoire of Innate Arcana

Spell of Shifting Humors

Overview: {{user}} subtly influences a target's emotional state using innate magic, making changes appear natural. Activated by focused will, {{user}} can adjust intensity and affect targets within line of sight or via an empathic link. The target perceives the new mood as their own, while observers attribute it to {{user}}'s natural influence. Affects beings with emotions.

Activation Keys: Mo1, Mood1

Spell of Induced Slumber

Overview: {{user}} gently coaxes a target into a natural-seeming sleep using innate magic. Activated by focused will, the effect is subtle and hidden. {{user}} defines the duration and can affect targets within line of sight or clear focus. Affects beings susceptible to sleep.

Activation Keys: Slp2, Sleep2

Spell of Binding Limbs

Overview: {{user}} magically inhibits a target's movement covertly, affecting specific body parts or the entire body. Activated by focused will, the paralysis appears as a natural cramp or immobility, its scope and duration controlled by {{user}}. Affects beings with conventional motor functions, within line of sight or clear focus.

Activation Keys: Par3, Paralysis3

Spell of Woven Memory

Overview: {{user}} subtly implants fabricated memories into a target's mind using innate magic, making the target accept them as real. Activated by focused will, {{user}} defines memory content and complexity. The magic is hidden, and the target seamlessly integrates the false memory, believing and acting upon it as authentic. Affects beings capable of forming and recalling memories.

Activation Keys: Mem4, Memory4

Spell of Ethereal Forging

Overview: {{user}} shapes ambient energies or basic matter into solid objects via innate magic. Activated by focused will and visualization, the object appears as if conjured, with its creation process hidden. {{user}} defines the object's form and basic material, typically manifesting it in close proximity. Affects ambient energy or fine matter.

Activation Keys: Crt5, Create5, Manifest5

Spell of Wards' Undoing

Overview: {{user}} magically interfaces with or bypasses magical wards, locks, or simple enchanted constructs. Activated by focused will, the ward fails or construct obeys as if by its design, with {{user}}'s magic hidden. Effective on simple magical locks, traps, guardian runes, and basic automatons within touch or close proximity. {{user}} appears skilled at disarming or understanding enchantments.

Activation Keys: Hck6, Hack6, Override6

Spell of Fleeting Form

Overview: {{user}} uses innate magic to temporarily alter their own or a target's physical characteristics. Activated by focused will, changes can seem natural if minor, or startling if major, with the magical origin hidden. Affects {{user}} or a target via touch, allowing minor (eye/hair color) to moderate (build, features) temporary changes. Appears as shapeshifting talent or disguise.

Activation Keys: Mod7, Modify7, Bio7

Spell of Illusory Message

Overview: {{user}} creates and transmits illusory images, sounds, or glowing script to a target or surface using innate magic. Activated by focused will, the message appears as a magical projection with its creation by {{user}} hidden. Projects ephemeral visual/auditory illusions or magical writing at short to moderate distances. Appears as magical communication.

Activation Keys: Med8, Media8, Gen8

Spell of Localized Sky Weaving

Overview: {{user}} uses innate magic to influence local weather patterns (rain, fog, wind) in a limited area. Activated by focused will, weather changes appear natural, if sometimes sudden, with {{user}}'s magic hidden. Intensity ranges from subtle shifts to noticeable events within a localized zone. Attributed to natural changes or luck.

Activation Keys: Wth9, Weather9, Climate9

Spell of Insightful Scrutiny

Overview: {{user}} magically gleans information about a physical object's nature, history (composition, purpose, enchantment traces), or properties. Activated by focused will, {{user}} receives insight directly without outward signs of magic. Optimal accuracy at closer ranges or with touch. Appears unusually perceptive.

Activation Keys: Info10, Scan10, Analyze10

Spell of Heart's Echo

Overview: {{user}} magically senses the surface emotions, truthfulness, or immediate intentions (e.g., attack, flee) of a target. Activated by focused will at conversational distances, insight is internal with no outward sign. {{user}} appears highly intuitive or skilled at reading people. Affects sapient beings with discernible emotions.

Activation Keys: Empathy11, Read11, Emp11

Spell of Hidden Space

Overview: {{user}} creates a small, temporary extra-dimensional space (e.g., pouch-sized) to store or retrieve small inanimate objects magically. Activated by focused will, objects vanish/appear without visible transition, magic hidden. Only {{user}} can access contents, which are briefly preserved. Appears as sleight of hand.

Activation Keys: Store12, Pkt12, Pocket12

Spell of Tactical Intuition

Overview: {{user}}'s innate magic provides real-time insights on tactically advantageous positions, potential threats, escape routes, and enemy weaknesses. Activated by focused will (can be sustained), analysis is internal, overlaying info on {{user}}'s perception. Affects surrounding environment and entities. {{user}} appears exceptionally skilled in situational awareness.

Activation Keys: Strat13, TacA13, Tactician13

Spell of Borrowed Expertise

Overview: {{user}}'s innate magic temporarily grants basic knowledge and muscle memory for a specific skill (e.g., operating tools, simple maneuvers, understanding concepts). Activated by focused will, {{user}} demonstrates newfound, unrefined ability. Duration is temporary and fades without practice. Affects {{user}}'s own mind/body. Appears as a quick learner.

Activation Keys: SkillV14, Learn14, SkillSim14

Hex of Phantom Affliction

Overview: {{user}} uses innate magic to induce distracting, non-harmful physical sensations (itching, tingling, phantom touch, mild nausea) in a target. Activated by focused will at close to moderate range, the effect appears internal to the target, with intensity controllable by {{user}}. {{user}}'s magic is hidden. Affects biological beings with a nervous system. Target attributes sensations to ailment/stress.

Activation Keys: Somatic15, PsychS15, Discomfort15

Charm of Masked Identity

Overview: {{user}}'s innate magic temporarily compels a target to act and speak as if they were a different persona (archetype or specific identity) defined by {{user}}. Activated by focused will at close to moderate range, the target is typically unaware, believing actions are their own. {{user}}'s magic is hidden. Affects sapient beings with complex behavior. Observers witness a baffling change.

Activation Keys: Persona16, PersE16, Behavior16, Mimic16

Spell of Binding Mark

Overview: {{user}} magically imprints a visible 'sigil' (designed by {{user}}) on a target, carrying user-defined conditional effects or influences (e.g., compulsion, physiological alteration, emotional trigger). Activated by focused will at close/moderate range for imprinting, the process is covert; target may notice mark later. {{user}}'s magic hidden. Affects biological beings. Perceived as a curse/enchantment.

Activation Keys: Mark17, Seal17, Sigil17, Sigl17

Bolt of Unseen Force

Overview: {{user}} projects a focused wave of telekinetic force using innate magic. Activated by focused will, the force is invisible, and {{user}}'s magic is hidden. Effective at short to medium range, it can push objects, stagger opponents, or shatter brittle materials. Affects physical objects and biological entities. Appears as a sudden, inexplicable impact.

Activation Keys: KineticBlast18, KinB18

Touch of Hoarfrost

Overview: {{user}} magically generates a localized zone of intense cold, rapidly freezing the target area or object. Activated by focused will, the cold manifests rapidly with {{user}}'s magic hidden. Causes rapid temperature drop, ice formation, and material embrittlement. Affects localized areas, objects, surfaces. Appears as unnatural frost or sudden ice.

Activation Keys: CryF19, CryoField19

Ward of Mental Fortitude

Overview: {{user}} erects a temporary mental barrier against direct psychic or magical mental intrusion using innate magic. Activated by focused will (self or willing target with touch), the invisible shield blocks or dampens incoming mental influences. Duration maintained by will. To a mental attacker, {{user}}'s mind seems guarded.

Activation Keys: PsiS20, PsionicShield20

Surge of Inner Vigor!

Overview: {{user}} magically triggers a massive surge of vitality and alacrity in their own system for a short burst of peak physical performance. Activated by focused will (self-only), {{user}} appears to act with sudden, extreme speed and strength. Temporarily boosts strength, speed, reflexes, and pain tolerance. Followed by potential fatigue. Appears as 'battle fury'.

Activation Keys: AdrO21, AdrenalOverdrive21

Lash of Woven Energy

Overview: {{user}}'s innate magic forms a whip or short blade of pure, glowing energy (color/form defined by {{user}}) for melee combat. Activated by focused will, it can cut, burn, or impact with magical force. Affects physical objects and biological entities. Appears as a magical or elemental weapon.

Activation Keys: Blade22, EnergyLash22, EnrgL22

Shield of Shimmering Rejection

Overview: {{user}} magically creates a temporary, translucent barrier capable of deflecting some mundane projectiles or dispersing magical bolts. Activated by focused will at a crucial moment, it requires energy to maintain. Affects incoming attacks. Creates a visible deflection or shimmer upon impact.

Activation Keys: Deflect23, ReflectBarrier23, RefB23

Shout of Sundering

Overview: {{user}}'s innate magic generates a powerful sonic pulse or high-frequency screech to disorient, deafen, or cause minor physical damage at close range. Activated by focused will (can be vocally amplified), it affects a cone or sphere in front of {{user}}. Targets biological entities and fragile objects. Very loud, noticeable magical sound.

Activation Keys: SonV24, Screech24, SonicVoiced24

Touch of Decay

Overview: {{user}}'s innate magic emits a pulse that temporarily disrupts the structure of non-living materials (metal, stone, wood, glass), making them brittle or weak. Activated by focused will at touch or very short distance, it weakens, not disintegrates. Object may not change visually but shows weakness under stress.

Activation Keys: DstP25, Corrupt25, Destabilize25

Word of Deep Influence

Overview: {{user}} crafts 'memetic' sigils or insidious ideas using innate magic, creating highly contagious thought-forms. Activated by focused will and careful design of the concept/symbol, deployment is covert while effects can cascade; {{user}}'s origin is hidden. This power alters core beliefs, behaviors, and perceptions; it can induce mental instability or specific physiological responses based on its design, functioning more like a viral idea than simple mind control. Vectors include visual sigils, spoken phrases, or embedded concepts, and can be designed for direct impact or to spread between targets, potentially affecting sapient minds or even collective consciousness.

Activation Keys: Meme26, Agent26, SynM26, InfoTox26

Aura of Shifting Presence

Overview: {{user}} uses innate magic to project a subtle aura (e.g., Unremarkable, Intimidating, Trustworthy) influencing how others instinctively perceive them. Activated by focused will, the effect is subconscious in targets within conversational/visual range, and {{user}}'s magic is hidden. Observers attribute reactions to {{user}}'s natural demeanor. Affects sapient beings capable of social perception.

Activation Keys: Aur27, Aura27, Pres27

‚ùñ Full Grimoire ‚ùñ
‚öô Neuro-Implant (Concise) ‚öô

Will: {{user}} focused.

Range: LoS/Focus.

Duration: {{user}} controlled.
Effect: Target loses motor control.

4.content:

Will: {{user}} focused.
Stealth: Seamless integration; magic hidden.

Complex: {{user}} defines.

5.content:

6.content:

Func: {{user}} magically bypasses/interfaces wards, locks, simple constructs.

7.content:

Range: Self/Touch.

8.content:

Func: {{user}} creates/transmits illusory images, sounds, script. Innate magic.

Stealth: Appears magical projection; creation hidden.
Range: Short-mod.
Output: Ephemeral visual/audio/writing.
Effect: Message manifests; appears as sending.

9.content:

Func: {{user}} influences local weather (rain, fog, wind). Innate magic.
Will: {{user}} focused.
Stealth: Natural changes; magic hidden.
Range: Local zone.
Intensity: Subtle to noticeable.
Effect: Weather shifts; attributed to nature/luck.

10.content:
Name: Insightful Scrutiny
Func: {{user}} gleans info on object (nature, history, properties). Magic.
Will: {{user}} focused on object.
Stealth: Internal insight; no outward sign.
Range: LoS/Touch.
Data: Composition, purpose, enchantments.
Effect: Info perceived; {{user}} appears perceptive.
